translation: adj.神圣的；受尊重的
examples: (1) In India the cow is a sacred animal.(2) We use them to protect our sacred grounds.(3) Nothing is sacred to these wild youths.(4) This area was hallowed by sacred memories.
(1) 在印度，牛是神圣的动物。(2) 我们使用它们来保卫我们神圣的土地。(3) 这些狂野的年轻人什么都不尊重。(4) 这个地区由于宗教上的纪念意义而被视为圣地。

translation: n.牺牲；祭品；供奉vt.牺牲；亏本出售；供奉vi.献祭；(棒球)作牺牲一击
examples: (1) He gave his life as a sacrifice for his country.(2) She made a big sacrifice for her position today.(3) A calf was offered up as a sacrifice to the goddess.(4) In the first scene, I sacrifice a sheep, taking its heart.(5) You must not sacrifice studies for pleasure.(6) It's the company's policy to sacrifice short-term profits for the sake of long-term growth.(7) He sacrificed his car when he go abroad to work.(8) The high priest sacrificed the goat on the altar.(9) Sacrifice is the ultimate act of self-giving love.(10) I have come to sacrifice to Jehovah.(11) As an additional cost to play Shard Volley, sacrifice a land.

(1) 他为国牺牲了。(2) 她为今天的职位付出了很大的代价。(3) 向女神祭献了一头牺牲小牛。(4) 第一幕场景中，我供奉了一只羊，取出了它的心脏。(5) 你不能为享乐而牺牲学业。(6) 为长期发展而牺牲短期利润是公司的方针。(7) 他到海外去工作的时候亏本出售了他的汽车。(8) 大祭司把山羊供奉在祭坛上。(9) 献祭却是最舍己的爱的行动。(10) 我来是要向耶和华献祭。(11) 作为碎片齐发的额外费用，牺牲一快地。

translation: n.悲哀
examples: (1) His sudden death was occasion for much sadness.(2) Try to pin down the exact quality of its sadness.
(1) 他的突然死亡是很多的悲哀场合。(2) 努力弄清楚它的确切的悲哀特点。

translation: v.航行；驾(船)n.帆；航行；航海
examples: (1) This ship sails for New York on Monday.(2) Can you sail a boat?(3) The sailors heaved at rope to tighten the sail.(4) Lower the sail or the boat will be knocked down.(5) They go for a sail down the Thames .(6) The ship is under sail, making toward the land.(7) Viking River Cruises and Avalon Waterways are some of the operators which sail the Yangtze.
(1) 这船将于星期一开往纽约。(2) 你会驾驶船只吗？(3) 水手们用力拉绳把帆绷紧。(4) 把帆放下来，否则船会被风吹翻的。(5) 他们乘船沿泰晤士河航行。(6) 船正朝大陆扬帆航行。(7) 航海巡线和亚洲龙水路线路由在长江航行的人提供。

translation: n.航行；航海；启航动词sail的现在分词.
examples: (1) The wind favoured their sailing at dawn.(2) The sea is too turbulent for sailing.(3) We shall inform you of the date of sailing.(4) They will outfit two days before sailing.
(1) 这风便于他们在黎明时航行。(2) 海浪太大，不宜航行。(3) 我方会将启航日期通知贵方。(4) 他们将在启航前两天准备航行之物。

translation: n.海员；水手；扁平的硬边草帽
examples: (1) He went about in the disguise of a sailor.(2) The sailor was rated as an ordinary seaman.(3) A sailor is at the mercy of the weather.
(1) 他伪装成海员到处流窜。(2) 那个水手被列为普通海员。(3) 水手受到天气的摆布。

translation: n.色拉；凉拌生菜；杂烩
examples: (1) It only takes a minute to make a salad.(2) I think I'll go for the fruit salad.(3) Onions must be chopped up to make a salad.
(1) 做色拉用不了多少时间。(2) 我想我还是要水果色拉吧。(3) 要做凉拌菜得把洋葱剁碎。

translation: n.薪水v.给 ... 薪水
examples: (1) His money comes mainly from salary.(2) I want to speak to her in the matter of my salary.(3) Don't worry about him, he will be salaried by a big company.(4) Like those who work for government or nonprofit organizations, they are salaried rather than paid a fee.
(1) 他的钱主要来自工资。(2) 我想跟她谈谈我的薪水问题。(3) 别为他担心,一家大公司会给他发薪水。(4) 同在政府或非盈利性组织工作的会计师一样，他们是挣工薪而不是按每笔业务收费。

translation: n.出售；促销
examples: (1) The law forbids the sale of alcohol to people under 18.(2) The local dress shop is having a sale.(3) Is this shampoo on sale today?
(1) 法律禁止向18岁以下的人出售含有酒精的饮料。(2) 附近的时装店正在大拍卖。(3) 这种洗发水今天减价出售吗？

translation: n.销售人员；推销员
examples: (1) The salesman's manner was abrupt to the point of rudeness.(2) The salesman cheated me into buying a fake.
(1) 这销售人员的态度唐突到粗鲁的程度。(2) 那个推销员骗我买了假货。

translation: n.女售货员；女店员
examples: (1) The saleswoman set aside the coat for the fat lady.(2) The man became embroiled this time with a saleswoman.
(1) 女售货员给这位胖女士留下了一件外套。(2) 这回那男子跟一名女售货员好上了。

translation: adj.咸的
examples: (1) We have a bowl of very salty pea and ham soup.(2) I like frenchfries because they are salty.
(1) 我们喝了一碗非常咸的豌豆火腿汤。(2) 我喜欢薯条因为它们是咸的。

translation: v.行礼；致意；问候n.致敬；敬礼；欢迎
examples: (1) We salute the flag everyday at school.(2) This ignoramus failed to salute me.(3) They saluted each other by raising their hats.(4) Shanghai people salute guests and friends from all over the world.(5) Salute Urbanus, our helper in Christ Jesus, and Stachys, my beloved.
(1) 我们在学校每天向国旗行礼。(2) 这个蠢汉看见我不行礼。(3) 他们举起帽子互相致意。(4) 上海人民向海内外宾朋致意。(5) 请问候我们在基督内的助手吴尔巴诺，和我可爱的斯塔辉。

translation: n.满意；赔偿；乐事；妥善处理；确信
examples: (1) Your satisfaction is guaranteed.(2) His face was expressive of satisfaction.(3) The winner beamed with satisfaction.(4) Looking at a beautiful painting always gives one satisfaction.(5) The store owner received satisfaction for the damage.(6) Unless you push your claims you'll get no satisfaction.(7) It was a great satisfaction to have revisited our native village.(8) I will dispose the matter to your satisfaction.(9) It's been proved to my satisfaction that you're telling the truth.(10) Can you demonstrate to our satisfaction that your story is true?
(1) 包你满意。(2) 他的脸上露出满意的神情。(3) 获胜者满意地笑了。(4) 观赏一幅美丽的图画使人心满意足。(5) 店主收到了对损坏的赔偿。(6) 如果你不努力争取,你就得赔偿。(7) 重访家乡是非常愉快的事。(8) 这件事我一定会处理妥当，包你满意。(9) 我确信你说的是实话。(10) 你能不能证实一下，让我们确信你说的是事实?

translation: v.使满意；满足；使信服；清偿
examples: (1) Some people are very hard to satisfy.(2) We always satisfy our customers with good service.(3) We must satisfy the people's needs.(4) Output cannot satisfy the demands of the market.(5) Her explanation did not satisfy the teacher.(6) He tried to satisfy the police of his innocence.(7) He has satisfied a claim for damages.
(1) 有些人是很难使其满意的。(2) 我们总是以良好的服务来满足顾客。(3) 我们要满足人民的需要。(4) 产量无法满足市场需求。(5) 她的解释没有让老师信服。(6) 他设法使警察相信他是无辜的。(7) 他已经答应赔偿损害的请求。

translation: n.酱汁；调味汁；无礼vt.给 ... 调味；使 ... 增加趣味；对 ... 无礼
examples: (1) Waiter, may I have steak sauce, please？(2) The cook poured the sauce over the food.(3) The secret of this dish is in the sauce.(4) He sauced criticism with flattery(5) Should I sauce this in soy sauce?(6) He sauced a talk with humour.(7) Good boys do not sauce their parents.(8) How dare you sauce your mother?
(1) 服务生,请给我一些牛排酱汁。(2) 厨师将调味汁倒在食物上。(3) 这道菜好吃的秘诀在于调味汁。(4) 他用谄媚来冲淡批评。(5) 我要不要给它加点儿酱油?(6) 他幽默的谈吐给报告增添了趣味。(7) 好孩子不会对父母无礼的。(8) 你怎么对你母亲这么无礼呢?

translation: n.茶托；碟子
examples: (1) He is drinking with a cup and saucer.(2) First, Linc pushed over a chair and jolted a knickknack table off its accustomed site hard enough so that a cup and saucer fell to the rug.(3) The cat has upset its saucer of milk.(4) I think I prefer the round plate and saucer,though.
(1) 他正在用带茶托的茶杯喝茶。(2) 第一，林克推翻了一个椅子，把一个放小摆设的小桌子用力的推离了原来的位置，使上面的一个杯子和茶托掉到了地毯上。(3) 那只猫打翻了它的牛奶碟子。(4) 虽然如此，我想我还是偏好圆形盘子和小碟子。

translation: n.香肠；腊肠
examples: (1) She loves sausage and mash.(2) Many people don't like blood sausage.(3) The sausage began to spit in the pan.(4) I'll take a pound of that sausage.
(1) 她喜欢香肠和土豆泥。(2) 很多人不喜欢黑香肠。(3) 锅里香肠开始滋滋作响。(4) 我买一磅那种腊肠。

translation: adj.野性的；凶猛的；粗鲁的；荒野的；原始的n.野蛮人；粗人；凶恶的人vt.激烈抨击；猛烈攻击
examples: (1) Most of the time elephants are tame but they can be very savage.(2) He was wild and savage, and no man could mount him, or do anything at all with him.(3) He smarted from the savage attacks on his film.(4) She was irritated by his savage behavior.(5) He likes savage mountain scenery.(6) The inhabitants were still in the savage state.(7) These civilizations flourished while Europeans were still savages living in caves.(8) There are no savage and civilised peoples; there are only different cultures.(9) Smith's play was savaged by the critics.
(1) 大多数时候大象很温顺,但他们也会大发野性。(2) 它既野又凶，谁都驾驭不了它，谁也对它没办法。(3) 他因自己的影片受到猛烈攻击而感到痛心。(4) 他的不文明行为激怒了她。(5) 他喜欢荒山的景色。(6) 这些居民仍处于野蛮状态。(7) 当欧洲人还是居住在洞穴中的野蛮人时，这些地方的文化早已十分繁荣昌盛。(8) 人无野蛮与文明之分,只是文化不同。(9) 史密斯的剧本遭到评论家的猛烈抨击。

translation: n.谚语；俗话；格言动词say的现在分词.
examples: (1) As the saying goes the early bird catches the worm.(2) An old trader's saying warns to be wary of smiling Squibs.(3) As the saying goes, a drowning man clutches at a straw.(4) Each woodcarving has a saying next to it.(5) This saying, therefore, teaches us to be industrious.
(1) 谚语说，早起的鸟有食吃。(2) 老生意人有句俗话，提醒你要当心满面堆笑的斯奎布人。(3) 正如俗话所说，溺水的人见到一根稻草也要抓。(4) 这些木雕旁一律配着一句格言。(5) 因此，这句格言教导我们要勤奋用功。

translation: vt.扫描；浏览；审视；细看vi.合韵律；划分音步n.扫描；浏览；细看
examples: (1) Could you teach me how to scan an image?(2) I scanned the newspaper when I was waiting for the bus.(3) She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.(4) I scanned my pocket for change.(5) The doctors gave him an ultrasonic brain scan.(6) I'm too busy to read the whole newspaper, I just scan the headline.(7) Employers receive many resumes and must scan each of them quickly.
(1) 你可以教我如何扫描一个影像吗?(2) 等公共汽车的时候，我匆匆浏览了一下报纸。(3) 她审视他的脸,试图探寻他在思考什么。(4) 我仔细查看囗袋找零钱。(5) 医生给他做了脑部超声波扫描检查。(6) 我太忙了，没法看整份报纸，只是浏览了一下大标题。(7) 雇主会收到许多简历，因此必须快速浏览它们。

translation: n.疤痕；伤痕；断崖v.结疤；痊愈
examples: (1) The scar flawed her beauty.(2) The cut in her hand has healed completely, without leaving a scar.(3) In that heart, where there had been a wound, there was a scar.(4) The wound gradually scarred over.(5) The cut on his finger will eventually scar over.(6) Her scar tissue would heal and she would have daily treatment with eye drops and cream.
(1) 这伤疤损害了她的美貌。(2) 她手上的刀伤完全愈合了,没有留下一点伤痕。(3) 在他的心上，从前有过一条伤口，后来只剩下一条伤痕。(4) 伤口渐渐愈合。(5) 他指头上的伤口最后会结疤痊愈。(6) 她的伤口组织会慢慢痊愈，每天还要滴眼药水和眼药膏。

translation: v.受惊吓；恐吓；吓走n.惊吓；惊恐
examples: (1) You scare them to death with your mouth.(2) We'll scare her out of telling the police.(3) His threats scared them out of carrying out the plan.(4) The dog scared the thief away.(5) You did give me a scare.(6) There was a bomb scare during the procession.
(1) 你一开口就能把人吓死。(2) 我们要把她吓得不敢报警。(3) 他的威胁迫使他们不敢实行该计划。(4) 狗把小偷吓走了。(5) 你真吓了我一跳。(6) 在列队行进时因怀疑有炸弹而引起恐慌。

translation: n.围巾
examples: (1) The price of this scarf is below ten dollars.(2) She twisted the long scarf round her head.(3) She threw a scarf over her shoulders.
(1) 这条围巾价格不到10美元。(2) 她把那条长围巾围在头上。(3) 她在肩上披上一块肩巾。

translation: n.情景；场；景
examples: (1) The terrible scene was engraved on his memory.(2) The first scene of the play is the king's palace.(3) A new chapter in a novel is something like a new scene in a play.(4) He drew a picture of wintry scene.
(1) 那可怕的情景铭记在他的记忆里。(2) 剧中的第一个场景是王宫。(3) 一部小说中新的一章,就象一出戏中新的一场。(4) 他画了一幅冬天景色的画。

translation: adj.怀疑的
examples: (1) He listened to me with a sceptical expression.
(1) 他听我讲话的时候带着怀疑的表情。

translation: n.时间表，日程；一览表；计划v.预定；安排；编制目录
examples: (1) I'll work out the schedule.(2) Please show me the taxation schedule.(3) Owing to various delays en route, we arrived two days behind schedule.(4) The morning is the best time of the day to schedule a briefing.(5) The professor was invited to schedule a new book.
(1) 我来拟定时间表。(2) 请让我看看税收一览表。(3) 由于路上的种种耽搁, 我们比原计划迟到了两天。(4) 简报最好安排在早上。(5) 那名教授受邀为一本新书编目录。

translation: n.学者；获奖学金的学生
examples: (1) He is a complete scholar.(2) He is not so much a writer as a scholar.(3) He ranks high as a scholar.(4) She impressed me as a scholar.(5) My tutor is an accomplished scholar.(6) The greatest scholar cannot solve this difficult problem.(7) He went abroad to study as a scholar.(8) She was a British Council scholar.
(1) 他是个无懈可击的学者。(2) 与其说他是作家倒不如说他是学者。(3) 他是第一流的学者。(4) 她给我留下了学者的印象。(5) 我的导师是一位学识渊博的学者。(6) 再伟大的学者也没有办法解答这个难题吧。(7) 他作为奖学金获得者赴外学习。(8) 她是英国文化协会奖学金的获得者。

translation: n.奖学金；学问；学识
examples: (1) The scholarship includes an allowance of 80 dollars for books.(2) He won a scholarship to Cambridge.(3) She has been awarded a scholarship to study at Harvard.(4) I have not the gifts that are necessary for scholarship.(5) The book is a demonstration of scholarship without pedantry.(6) He is a teacher of great scholarship.(7) He combines creative imagination and true scholarship.
(1) 奖学金包括八十美元的书籍费津贴。(2) 他获得一份到剑桥大学读书的奖学金。(3) 她获得了去哈佛大学读书的奖学金。(4) 我没有做学问所必须的天资。(5) 这本书表现出学术水平又不故意卖弄学问。(6) 他是一位学识渊博的教师。(7) 他同时具有创造性想象力和真正的治学谨严学风。

translation: n. 学校毕业生； 离校生；辍学者
examples: (1) The VTC continues to run the Foundation Diploma and the Certificate in Vocational Studies for Secondary 5 and Secondary 3 school leavers, respectively.
(1) 职业训练局继续为中五及中三离校生开办基础文凭课程及中专证书课程。

translation: n.同学；校友
examples: (1) He met an old schoolmate at the party.(2) Mary's brother is my schoolmate, but two years senior to my grade.
(1) 他在宴会上遇见了一位老同学。(2) 玛丽的哥哥跟我是校友,只是比我高两届。

translation: adj.科学的
examples: (1) We all support his scientific research.(2) He took a very scientific approach to management.(3) He is engaged in scientific pursuit.
(1) 我们都支持他的科学研究。(2) 他采取了一种非常科学的管理方法。(3) 他从事科学研究。

translation: v.责骂；训斥n.斥责；爱责骂的人
examples: (1) Don't scold the child without reason.(2) You shouldn't scold him on the slightest pretence.(3) I hate to scold, but you mustn't scatter your things all over the place.(4) The disobedient son went out of his way to scold his parents.(5) His father gave him a bad scold this morning.(6) Mother's scold stabbed her to the heart.
(1) 不可无缘无故地责骂小孩。(2) 你不应该以一点点借口就责骂他。(3) 我不想训斥你，但你总不该把东西到处乱丢。(4) 这个不孝顺的儿子越出常轨谴责父母。(5) 他父亲今晨狠狠训了他一顿。(6) 妈妈的责骂刺伤了她的心。

translation: vt.得分；获胜；刻划；划线；批评；给 ... 谱曲n.得分；刻痕；二十；乐谱vi.得分；记分；得胜
examples: (1) Hughes scored two goals before half-time.(2) They scored the floor-boards by pushing furniture about.(3) could you please score my name off?(4) Critics scored him for his foolishness.(5) He learned how to score a musical composition.(6) I recorded the score in a notebook.(7) There are deep scores on the rock.(8) He bought two score of apples yesterday.(9) Look at the score and try to play that song.(10) This is continued until a complete score is written.(11) The home team has yet to score.(12) Who is going to score for both sides?(13) That is where you score over others.
(1) 休斯在上半场进了两个球.(2) 他们推动家具(3) 请把我的名字从名单中划掉好吗?(4) 评论家批评他愚蠢。(5) 他学会了怎样谱曲。(6) 我在笔记本上记下了分数。(7) 岩石上有深深的刻痕。(8) 他昨天买了四十个苹果。(9) 看乐谱演奏一下那首曲子。(10) 这样一直继续到整个乐谱写完。(11) 主队还没有得分.(12) 谁来为双方记分?(13) 那是你优于别人的地方。

translation: adj.苏格兰的n.苏格兰人；苏格兰语
examples: (1) This Scottish plant was a gift from my cousin.(2) I thought you were cursing at me in scottish.
(1) 这棵苏格兰植物是我的一个表亲给我的礼物。(2) 我以为你在用苏格兰话骂我。

translation: v.抓；搔（痒）；划破；划掉n.抓痕；乱写；抓的声音；起跑线adj.无让步的
examples: (1) The dog is scratching at the door.(2) He pretended to scratch his ear.(3) I had to scratch my head to remember his name.(4) Be careful not to scratch the furniture.(5) He scratched out my name on that list.(6) Will you scratch that sticker off the car window?(7) You can clean the scratch with alcohol.(8) He heard the scratch of a match.(9) His career started from scratch.(10) I decide to learn English from scratch.
(1) 狗正在抓门。(2) 他假装搔耳朵。(3) 我只想苦苦地回忆他的名字。(4) 小心别刮坏家具。(5) 他把我的名字从那个名单上删除。(6) 请你把车窗上的那张贴纸撕下好吗?(7) 你可以用酒精把擦痕去掉。(8) 他听到划火柴的声音。(9) 他的事业从头开始。(10) 我决定从头学习英语。

translation: n.尖叫声v.尖叫；（指风﹑ 机器等）发出大而尖的声音
examples: (1) The patient gave out a scream of pain.(2) A scream broke the silence of the night.(3) The boy was screaming with pain.(4) The wind screamed through the trees.(5) I pressed the accelerator until the engine screamed.
(1) 病人痛苦地尖叫一声。(2) 一声尖叫划破了寂静的夜空。(3) 这男孩痛得尖叫起来。(4) 风从林间呼啸而过。(5) 我猛踩油门,发动机发出了尖利的声音。

translation: n.雕塑；雕刻v.雕刻；雕塑；刻蚀；当雕刻师
examples: (1) He was a professor of sculpture at the Academy.(2) The smooth contour of the sculpture is wonderful.(3) She studied sculpture at art school.(4) There are two horses sculptured in bronze at the gate.(5) The water had sculptured the rocks into strange shapes.
(1) 他在学院是一位雕塑教授。(2) 雕塑物平滑的轮廓线简直太美了。(3) 她在美术学校学习雕刻。(4) 在大门口有两匹用青铜雕塑的马。(5) 水把岩石侵袭得奇形怪状。

translation: n.海鸥
examples: (1) A seagull fluttered down with an injured wing.(2) We praised the courage of the seagull.
(1) 一只海鸥拍打着翅膀飞落下来。(2) 我们赞颂海鸥的勇敢。

translation: n.封条；印章n.海豹v.密封；盖印；明确
examples: (1) The seal on this bottle is broken.(2) This document carries the royal seal.(3) The first time I saw a seal was in an aquarium.(4) The envelope was firmly sealed.(5) You must seal up the envelope before mailing the letter.(6) They signed and sealed the treaty.(7) The newlywed royal couple sealed their marriage on Friday with an iconic appearance on the balcony of Buckingham Palace before an ecstatic crowd of thousands of well-wishers.
(1) 这个瓶上的密封纸破开了。(2) 这份文件上盖有王室印章。(3) 我第一次看见海豹是在水族馆里。(4) 这个信封封得很严实。(5) 你在寄信前必须先将信封密封。(6) 他们在条约上签名盖章。(7) 周五，这对新婚的皇室夫妇在白金汉宫的阳台上，在数千前来祝福的欣喜若狂的民众前，以标志性的露面明确了他们的婚姻。

translation: n.海员；水手
examples: (1) In1929 he took a job as a seaman.(2) We have many skilled seamen on our ship.(3) The captain of a ship is above a seaman.
(1) 1929年他当了海员。(2) 我们船上有很多有经验的水手。(3) 船长地位高于水手。

translation: n.海贝；贝壳
examples: (1) Small seashells were often used as a primitive kind of money.(2) This seashell with a radiating shape looks beautiful.(3) Have you ever held a seashell to your ear and heard the roar of the ocean?
(1) 小贝壳常被用作简单的货币。(2) 这个放射形的贝壳很好看。(3) 你曾把贝壳贴在耳边，倾听过海洋的呼啸吗?

translation: n.海边adj.海边(的)；海滨(的)
examples: (1) He is walking down the seaside.(2) We had an outing to the seaside last summer.(3) The seaside fish market is a ready food supply for scavenging seabirds.(4) The seaside city is subject to frequent typhoon.(5) Dalian is a well laid out seaside city.
(1) 他正沿海边走去。(2) 我们去年夏天去海边旅行。(3) 海边鱼市是觅食海鸟现成的食物供应地。(4) 这座海滨城市经常遭受台风的袭击。(5) 大连是一个规划良好的 海滨城市.

translation: n.海草；海藻
examples: (1) The smell of seaweed took him back to his childhood.(2) This substance is extracted from seaweed.(3) The rocks had green seaweed growing on them.
(1) 海草的气味使他回想起童年时代。(2) 这种物质是从海藻中提取的。(3) 礁石上生长著绿色的海藻。

translation: adj.二手的；间接的；古旧的；做旧货买卖的adv.间接地；作为旧货地
examples: (1) He is in the secondhand car trade.(2) The store deals in secondhand clothes.(3) At a secondhand store I ran across the works of his early years.(4) I only heard about it secondhand.(5) This is a book I bought secondhand years ago.
(1) 他是从事二手车买卖的。(2) 这家商店经营旧衣服。(3) 我在一家旧货店无意中碰到了他早年的作品.(4) 我是间接得到这个消息的。(5) 这是我几年前买的一本旧书。

translation: n.部长；秘书；书记；大臣；写字台
examples: (1) He was the then secretary of Defense.(2) He buzzed for his secretary to come.(3) My secretary is an absolute gem.(4) At this moment she noticed the secretary coming in.(5) The Colonial Secretary was continued in office.(6) The secretary is proposing to stand down in favor of a younger man.(7) Janet put several dictionaries on the shelf of her secretary.(8) Emily doesn't have a secretary, so she has to write her essay on the tea table.
(1) 他是当时的国防部长。(2) 他按蜂鸣器叫秘书进来。(3) 我的秘书真是个难能可贵的人。(4) 这时她注意到书记走了进来。(5) 殖民大臣留任。(6) 这位大臣打算辞职，让位给一个比较年轻的人。(7) 珍妮特在她的写字台架子上放了几本字典。(8) 艾米莉没有写字台，所以她只能在茶几上写论文。

translation: n.部分；部门；章节；区域；断面；剖面图；零件；路段；切开v.划分；切开
examples: (1) White lines divide the playing area into sections.(2) I hope someone competent will join our section.(3) The report has a section on accidents at work.(4) She lives near the business section.(5) This illustration shows a section through the timber.(6) The architect drew the house in section.(7) While driving on the bumpy section of the road, he switches on the shock-absorbers.(8) The surgeon performed a section on the vein.
(1) 这些白线把赛区分成各个部分。(2) 我希望有能力的人加入本部门。(3) 报告中有一段谈到工作中的事故问题。(4) 她住在商业区附近。(5) 本图所示为木材的纵剖面。(6) 建筑师画出房子的剖面图。(7) 在路面不平的路段他开启了减震器。(8) 外科医生施行了静脉切开手术。

translation: adj.安全的；牢靠的；稳妥的vt.使安全；获得；固定
examples: (1) If you are not sure it is secure, do not debug it.(2) His place in history is now secure.(3) A climber needs secure footholds.(4) We must create a secure and reliable international environment of lasting peace and stability.(5) The document shall be kept in a secure place.(6) Some measures are needed to secure the farmland against shift sand.(7) There is no magic wand to secure a just peace.(8) We must prepare our claim and send it to the insurance company to secure payment.(9) Remove the five screws that secure the battery tray to the vehicle.(10) The gate won't stay open, so we'll have to secure it to the post.

(1) 如果您不能确定它是安全的,请不要调试它。(2) 他在历史上的地位现在已经稳固了。(3) 攀登的人脚踩的地方要很牢固。(4) 我们要创造安全可靠、长期稳定的国际和平环境。(5) 文件应保管在安全的地方。(6) 需要采取措施使农田免遭流沙的侵袭。(7) 要获得正义的和平并非易事。(8) 我们得准备好索赔要求，并把它寄给保险公司以便获得赔偿。(9) 拆下固定电池架到车身的五个螺丝。(10) 大门不能一直开着,所以我们不得不将它固定在柱子上。

translation: n.安全；保证；证券；债券；抵押；防护措施
examples: (1) I'll undertake for your security.(2) Our own actions are our security.(3) He traded in securities and became rich.(4) The value of a derivative is based on another security.(5) He has given his house as security for the loan.(6) A life insurance policy may serve as security for a loan.(7) We need greater security in car parks.
(1) 我将保证你的安全。(2) 我们的行为是自己的保证。(3) 他做证券交易发了财。(4) 金融衍生工具的价值以另一种债券为基准。(5) 他以抵押自己的房屋作为贷款的担保。(6) 人寿保险可作贷款的抵押。(7) 我们需要加强停车场的安全措施.

translation: n.种子vi.播种；(植物)结实vt.播种
examples: (1) The farmers were scattering seed on the fields.(2) Part of every crop is saved for seed.(3) Most plants propagate by seed.(4) Do you know about the evolution of a seed into a plant?(5) Peasants plough up and seed in the spring !(6) These plants will not seed in a cold climate.(7) The fields have been seeded with corn.
(1) 农夫把种子撒在田里。(2) 每一种庄稼都留一部分作种子。(3) 大多数植物靠种子繁殖。(4) 你知道从种子发展成为植物的过程吗？(5) 农民在春天犁地播种。(6) 这些植物在寒冷气候里不会结子。(7) 田里播种了玉米。

translation: vt.寻求；追求；试图vi.寻找
examples: (1) Tortured by fear, he decided to seek the aid of a psychiatrist.(2) Many single people are seeking that special someone.(3) Some nations will seek the change of their energy supply sources to reduce emissions, or for other reasons.(4) You seek all day and you find it, and then you realize that it is worthless.
(1) 他终日恐惧不安,决定寻求心理医生的帮助。(2) 许多单身人士都在追求他们的唯一。(3) 为了减少碳排量,或是出于其他原因,一些国家试图改变他们的能源供应来源。(4) 你终日寻寻觅觅,找到了,之后却发现那根本不值得寻找。

translation: n.跷跷板adj.反复变化的；摇摆不定的vi.玩跷跷板
examples: (1) Near the seesaw I saw a saw saw the wood into four.(2) How may saws could a see-saw saw if a see-saw could saw saws?
(1) 在跷跷板附近，我看见一个锯子把那木头锯成四段。(2) 如果跷跷板能看见锯子的话，它能看见几个？

translation: v.抓住；夺取；利用；没收
examples: (1) Seize the chance, otherwise you'll regret it.(2) Before he could run away, she seized him by the collar.(3) He would seize upon any excuse to justify himself.(4) They seize the drugs and arrest the people on the boats.
(1) 抓住这个机会，否则你会后悔的。(2) 在他逃跑之前,她抓住了他的衣领。(3) 他会利用任何借口为自己辩解。(4) 他们没收毒品,逮捕船上的人。

translation: adv.很少；难得
examples: (1) The apple tree is seldom fruitful.(2) I have seldom seen such brutality.(3) We go out very seldom.(4) She seldom, if ever, goes to the cinema.
(1) 这棵苹果树很少结果。(2) 我很少见到这种暴行。(3) 我们绝少外出。(4) 她难得看电影。

translation: v.选择；挑选adj.精选的；优等的n.被挑选出来的人或物
examples: (1) Please select a channel to begin with from left.(2) She lets her son select his own Christmas present.(3) They select him to their leader.(4) She selected a diamond ring from the collection.(5) You may select those books you like best.(6) A select group were invited to the wedding reception.(7) Select film excerpts will be played on the film festival.(8) This is a very select area; you have to be rich to live here.
(1) 请从左边选择一个频道。(2) 她让儿子自己选择圣诞礼物。(3) 他们选择他为他们的领导人。(4) 她从收藏品中挑选了一枚钻石戒指。(5) 你可以从那些书中挑选你最喜欢的书。(6) 一群经过挑选的人士被邀请参加婚宴。(7) 精选电影摘录将在电影节播放。(8) 这是高级住宅区，你必须有钱才能住在这里。

translation: n.自己；本性；自我pron.我自己；你自己；他或她自己adj.始终如一的；同一类型的；性质不变的v.近亲繁殖；自花授粉
examples: (1) He is now out of all conceit with his former self.(2) I do not like to go to the movies by my self.(3) Suddenly it all falls out of relation to her basic henny self, and she realizes she has lost her life.(4) Knowledge of self increases as one gets older.(5) There are many doorways to your Divine Self.(6) I was looking for some resemblance between my ancestor and my self.(7) Before doing anything, ask your Higher Self, God, and us angels to guide you.(8) If you would have a faithful servant, and one that you like, serve your self.

(1) 他现在全盘否定了他原来的自己。(2) 我不喜欢自己一个人看电影。(3) 瞬间这一切与她如母鸡一样的本性毫无关系，她意识到她已失去了自己的生活。(4) 随着年岁的增长，人们的自我认识也不断加深。(5) 通往你的神性自我有许多门道。(6) 我在寻找我的祖先和我自己之间的某些相似之处。(7) 在你做任何事之前，祈请你自己的高我，上主，和天使来引领你。(8) 如果你想得到一个忠诚的仆人，这个人就是你自己。

translation: adj.自私的；利己的
examples: (1) A selfish person always thinks about himself.(2) I am becoming more and more irritated by his selfish behaviour.(3) I call his behaviour mean and selfish.(4) Nobody but you could be so selfish.(5) I have been a selfish being all my life, in practice, though not in principle.
(1) 一个自私的人总是想着自己。(2) 我对他那种自私的行为愈加恼火起来。(3) 我认为他的行为卑鄙、 自私。(4) 除了你之外，谁也不会这样自私。(5) 我生平是个利己的人，虽然只在实践而非原则上如此。

translation: adj.自选的；顾客自理的
examples: (1) adj.自选的；顾客自理的

translation: n.半圆；半圆形；半圆物
examples: (1) An angle in a semicircle is a right angle.(2) We sat in a semicircle round the fire.(3) We sat in a semicircle facing the teacher.
(1) 半圆所对的圆周角是直角。(2) 我们坐在炉火前，围成一个半圆形。(3) 我们面对着老师坐成半圆形。

translation: adj.地位较高的；高级的；年长的；资深的n.上司；年长者；长辈；大四学生
examples: (1) He is senior to me, though he is younger.(2) She was unfit for such a senior position.(3) Lying north of the church is a girls' senior high school.(4) A senior member of the committee is authorized to act for the chairman during his absence.(5) The three vice-ministers are my seniors.(6) He is my senior by two years.(7) This is a senior of the profession.(8) The seniors defeated the juniors by 3-1.
(1) 他地位比我高，虽然他比我年轻。(2) 她不能胜任这样的高级职位。(3) 位于这座教堂以北的是一所女子高中。(4) 主席不在时,授权委员会中的一位资深委员代理他的职务。(5) 三位副部长都是我的上司。(6) 他比我大两岁。(7) 这是一位同行中的老前辈。(8) 四年级学生以三比一战胜了三年级学生。

translation: n.感官；感觉；意识；鉴赏力；意义；理智；道理；见识v.感觉；意识到；理解；检测
examples: (1) I lost my sense of taste.(2) I'm afraid I haven't got a very good sense of directions, so I easily get lost.(3) He felt an overwhelming sense of loss.(4) Your brother has a good sense of humor.(5) Scholars tend to lack a sense of proportion.(6) The sense of the word is not clear.(7) The sense of the novel is the inevitability og human tragedy.(8) Forget it. He had lost his senses.(9) Don't act so foolishly, John. Come to your senses.(10) There is no sense in waiting three hours.(11) There is a lot of sense in what she has said.(12) The horse sensed danger and stopped.(13) Lisa sensed that he did not believe her.(14) Can you sense the essence of this poem?(15) The apparatus can sense the presence of toxic gases.

(1) 我丧失了味觉。(2) 恐怕我的方位感很差，因此我容易迷路。(3) 他感到非常失落。(4) 你兄弟很有幽默感。(5) 学者往往缺乏冷静地辨别轻重缓急的能力。(6) 这个词的意义不明确。(7) 这部小说的含义是人类悲剧的不可避免性。(8) 别放在心上。他是失去理智了。(9) 别丑态百出啦，约翰，放理智点。(10) 等三个小时是不合理的。(11) 她说的话很有见地。(12) 马感觉到了危险，于是停了下来。(13) 莉萨意识到他不相信她。(14) 你能理解这首诗的精华吗？(15) 这个仪器能够检测出有毒气体的存在。

translation: adj.灵敏的；敏感的；感光的；易受伤害的；善解人意的n.敏感的人
examples: (1) She's got very sensitive hearing, skin, etc.(2) Don't be so sensitive and I was not criticizing you.(3) What food and fruit are sensitive?(4) The film is coated with light sensitive chemicals, which are change by the different shades and colors of light.(5) Wear rubber gloves if you have very sensitive skin.
(1) 她的听觉、 触觉等很灵敏。(2) 别那么敏感,我不是在批评你。(3) 哪些食物和水果是感光的？(4) 胶卷上涂了一层感光的化学物质，这些物质因光的不同色度与颜色而改变。(5) 如果你的皮肤容易受伤的话,就带上橡胶手套。

translation: n.句子；判决vt.宣判；判决
examples: (1) It is a fact that I have written this sentence.(2) The judge will pass sentence tomorrow after looking at the report.(3) He has been sentenced to pay a fine of 1000 pounds.
(1) 我写了这个句子是事实。(2) 法官看完报告后明天会做出判决。(3) 他被判罚款1000英镑。

translation: adj.分开的；不同的；单独的；各自的v.分开；隔开；区分；分居；脱离n.分开；抽印本
examples: (1) Can these two definitions be conflated, or must they be kept separate?(2) I advocate separate classes for students to learn Chinese in different ways.(3) We don't have a separate dining room—the living area is all one.(4) The house is divided into two living units or residences, usually having separate entrances.(5) We'd better separate the good ones from the bad ones.(6) This examination is intended to separate the sheep from the goats.(7) Children suffer from divided loyalties when their parents separate.(8) We should never separate from the masses.(9) Nothing can separate them from each other now.(10) It's hard for me to separate the two fighting boys.

(1) 这两个定义可以合成一个呢，还是必须分开?(2) 我建议我们分班授课，让不同的学生以不同的方式学习华文。(3) 我们没有单独的饭厅——活动空间都在一处。(4) 房屋分为两个居住部分,一般具有各自的出口。(5) 我们最好把好的和坏的分开。(6) 这次考试就是想区分一下水平高低。(7) 父母分居时孩子们会因不知对谁忠诚为好而感到痛苦。(8) 我们绝不应该脱离群众。(9) 现在什么也不能把他们彼此分开了。(10) 我很难把这两个打架的孩子分开。

translation: adv.分别地；个别地；独立地；分开地
examples: (1) He said he would see each of us separately.(2) We saw the play separately and compared notes afterwards.(3) Please be sure that you wrap each item separately.(4) None of us can afford it separately, so let's pool our money.(5) Living separately from parents after marriage is all the mode today.
(1) 他说他将分别约见我们每一个人。(2) 我们各自看了那出戏,后来交换了意见。(3) 请确保个别地包装每件物品。(4) 我们中无人能独立应付，所以让我们把钱凑起来。(5) 婚后与父母分开住是现在非常流行的做法。

translation: n.分离；分居；缺口；分隔线；[化]离析；【航】间隔
examples: (1) Separation from her children was a terrible wrench.(2) He reminded me of the separation of church and state.(3) Friends managed to reconcile him with his wife after years of separation.
(1) 同她的孩子们分别是一项很大的痛苦。(2) 他提醒我政教是分离的。(3) 经过多年分居后朋友们设法使他与妻子重修旧好。

translation: n.仆人
examples: (1) Satan is still a servant of God.(2) The servant enjoyed his master's confidence.(3) He is a humble and submissive servant.(4) A politician should be a servant of the people.
(1) 撒旦仍是上帝的奴仆。(2) 这仆人深得主人的信赖。(3) 他是个恭顺的仆人。(4) 政治家应是人民的公仆。

translation: n.服务；发球；服役；公务部门；礼拜仪式；(车辆、机器等定期的)维修v.保养；维护；提供服务；支付(借款)利息
examples: (1) The volunteers for community service are doing a good job.(2) We all complain about the poor service in the hotel coffee lounge.(3) You must run fast enough to return his service.(4) I'd like to know something about badminton game,first,can you tell me about the service?(5) His poor health disbarred him from further service in the army.(6) His military service was deferred.(7) His father had been in the diplomatic service.(8) I have a service passport to America.(9) Mass is a kind of Church service.(10) He suggested that my car should be serviced.(11) We have the machines serviced regularly.(12) And once in orbit,there's no inexpensive and simple way to service them.(13) The power station is serviced by road transport.(14) I had to service a lot of debts last year.

(1) 社区服务的义工做得很出色。(2) 我们都抱怨饭店咖啡休息室的劣质服务。(3) 你必须要跑得很快才可能接起他的发球。(4) 我想了解一下羽毛球比赛，能否先给我说说发球?(5) 因身体欠佳，他不能继续在军队服役。(6) 他被允许缓期服役。(7) 他的父亲曾在外交部门供职。(8) 我有美国的公务护照。(9) 弥撒是教会的一种礼拜仪式。(10) 他建议我把汽车送去保养。(11) 我们请人定期维修机器。(12) 一旦进入轨道，也没有一套简便和低耗的方式来对它们进行维护。(13) 这座发电站的燃料是通过公路运送的。(14) 去年我不得不为债务支付大量的利息。

translation: n.会议；会期；开庭期；学期；一段时间
examples: (1) If the negotiations between the rich northerly nations and poor southerly nations make headway, it is intended that a ministerial session in December should be arranged.(2) Several bills were enacted at the end of this session of Parliament.(3) Is Parliament in session during the summer?(4) Be seated! This court is now in session.(5) The Congress ended its first session on January4.(6) She attended the summer session of college.
(1) 要是北方富国和南方穷国之间的谈判获得进展的话,就打算在十二月份安排召开部长级的会议。(2) 这届国会结束时，好几个议案制定成为法律。(3) 议会在夏季是开会期吗?(4) 请坐下！本庭现在开庭。(5) 代表大会第一次会议在1月4日结束。(6) 她上大学的暑期班。

translation: v.解决；定居；安顿；平静；结算n.背长椅，座位；定居，安顿
examples: (1) If you pay for both of us now, we can settle up later.(2) An official mission was sent to settle the dispute.(3) The two companies settled out of court.(4) They moved the local people and settle them in another place.(5) He's of an age when he ought to settle down.(6) The thunderstorm may settle the weather.
(1) 你要是现在先付清咱们两人的帐，事后咱们俩再细算。(2) 一个官方使团被派去解决争端。(3) 两家公司在法院外了结了争端。(4) 他们把当地人迁移到别处定居。(5) 他已经到了应该安顿下来的年龄了。(6) 这场雷暴过后天气可能反而好些。

translation: n.解决；结算；协议；安置；殖民；定居
examples: (1) There is no prospect of a settlement of the dispute.(2) Negotiators are looking for a peaceful settlement to the dispute.(3) After much discussion the negotiators hammered out a compromise settlement.(4) I enclose a cheque in settlement of your account.(5) The pressure is now on the unions to reach a settlement.(6) They hope to be able to patch together a temporary settlement.(7) The long French sojourn in Canada before English settlement has left its marks.
(1) 这场纠纷根本不可能获得解决。(2) 谈判双方正寻求和平解决争端的办法。(3) 双方经多次谈判达成一项折衷的解决办法。(4) 兹附支票一张以结清贵处帐目。(5) 目前正对各工会施加压力，要他们达成协议。(6) 他们希望能草草搭成一个临时安置区。(7) 在英国殖民者之前，法国人在加拿大的长期居留也留下了痕迹。

translation: n.【C】移居者；定居者
examples: (1) The settlers were soon acclimated.(2) One of his forefathers was an early settler in America.(3) The government allotted a stretch of land to each settler.
(1) 移居者很快就适应了。(2) 他的祖先之一是美洲的早期移民。(3) 政府分配给每个居民一块地。

translation: num.十七
examples: (1) We covered seventeen miles on foot.(2) My grandmother got married at the age of seventeen.
(1) 我们步行了十七英里。(2) 我的祖母十七岁就结婚了。

translation: num.第七；七分之一
examples: (1) He was laid out in the seventh round.(2) It has just entered the seventh edition.(3) He's pulled up from the seventh to the second place.(4) A seventh of the profit will be sent to charity.
(1) 他在第七回合中被打倒了。(2) 它刚出版了第七版。(3) 他已从第七名跃升到第二名。(4) 七分之一的利润将捐赠慈善事业。

translation: 七十
examples: (1) We were bowling along (the motorway) at seventy miles per hour.(2) This hall holds a maximum of seventy people.(3) You should forgive him for his forgetfulness; after all, he is over seventy.(4) I pay him seventy dollars a week.(5) The temperature today is seventy degrees Fahrenheit.(6) His grandfather is nearly seventy.
(1) 我们以每小时七十英里的速度(在高速公路上)飞驰。(2) 这厅最多容纳七十人。(3) 你应该原谅他的健忘症，毕竟他已经七十多岁了。(4) 我一星期付给他70美元。(5) 今天气温是华氏七十度。(6) 他爷爷快七十岁了。

translation: adj.严厉的；严重的；剧烈的；严格的；严峻的
examples: (1) The premier came under severe criticism.(2) He's suffering from severe mental disorder.(3) A severe storm turned the small village down to ground.(4) The new product has stood a severe proof .(5) They can withstand severe tests.
(1) 这位总理遭到严厉的抨击。(2) 他患有严重的精神病。(3) 一场剧烈的风暴把小村夷为平地。(4) 新产品经受了严格的考验。(5) 他们能经得起严峻的考验。

translation: v.缝合；缝纫
examples: (1) The skirt is finished I'm now going to sew a pocket on.(2) I'll just sew up that tear, and the coat will be as good as new.(3) Sew that part all along.(4) She preferred to sew rather than to knit.(5) The quickest way to sew is with a sewing machine.
(1) 裙子做好了--我现在再缝上个口袋。(2) 我把大衣的破处缝好，就会完好如新了。(3) 把那部分从头到尾缝合起来。(4) 她喜欢缝纫而不喜欢编织。(5) 最快的缝纫办法是用缝纫机。

translation: n.性别；性欲；性vt.区别 ... 性别；引起 ... 性欲
examples: (1) Everybody can come to this school,without respect to class, race, or sex.(2) She disguised her true sex under a man's garment.(3) Hunger and sex are elemental drives of human beings.(4) The movie is full of sex and violence.(5) It's difficult to sex newborn chicks.
(1) 不论阶级、种族、性别,人人都可以进这所学校上课。(2) 她身穿男装来掩饰自己的真实性别。(3) 食欲和性欲是人类的原始冲动。(4) 这部电影充满了性和暴力。(5) 新生小鸡雏的性别是很难判断的。

translation: adj.破旧的；寒酸的；低劣的，无耻的；卑劣的
examples: (1) He owns nothing beyond the shabby house.(2) His shabby appearance creates a bad impression.(3) She is none the less beautiful for her shabby clothing.(4) His reasoning is weak, even shabby.(5) He even plays a shabby trick on his father.
(1) 除了那个破旧的房子,他一无所有。(2) 他那寒酸的样子给人留下不好的印象。(3) 即使她衣衫褴褛，却仍然美丽。(4) 他的论证软弱无力，甚至可以说很拙劣。(5) 他甚至同他的父亲玩弄卑鄙的手段。

translation: n.阴影；遮蔽；遮光物；(色彩的)浓淡vt.遮蔽；使阴暗；使渐变；略减（价格）vi.渐变
examples: (1) This artist uses shade to good effect.(2) There are no trees or bushes to give shade.(3) Something,such as a window shade or a Venetian blind,that hinders vision or shuts out light.(4) The portrait shows fine effects of light and shade.(5) He tried to shade his house with thick trees.(6) He tried to shade in one side of his drawing.(7) Is it possible to shade the prices a little?(8) The colors of the light shaded from blue into purple.
(1) 这位画家有效地利用阴影。(2) 没有树木或灌木丛可以遮荫。(3) 遮光物如窗帘或软百叶窗等能遮挡视线或挡住阳光的物体。(4) 这幅肖像画的浓淡色调表现得很好。(5) 他想让这些大树把房子遮住。(6) 他想把他那幅画的一边涂成阴影。(7) 有没有可能降一点价格?(8) 光线的颜色由蓝逐渐变紫。

translation: n.影子；阴影；阴暗；荫；暗处vt.投阴影于；跟踪；预示vi.渐变；变阴暗adj.影子内阁的；阴影的
examples: (1) The tree cast its shadow on the wall.(2) His shadow followed him along the road.(3) The scandal cast a shadow on his career.(4) Sometimes she sits alone in the shadow.(5) He walked along in the shadows hoping no one would recognize him.(6) Figmentary fears can shadow our whole existence.(7) He employed a detective to shadow his wife.(8) If there is no shadow, spring is on the way.(9) Any pregnant woman who paed through her shadow would miscarry.(10) Add a Drop Shadow to the sketchbook using a simple layer style.
(1) 树影映在墙上。(2) 他的影子一路上跟着他。(3) 这件丑闻给他的事业投上了一层阴影。(4) 有时候她独自一人坐在幽暗处。(5) 他走在暗处，希望没有人认出他来。(6) 想像中的恐惧能使我们整个生活蒙上阴影。(7) 他雇用了一名私人侦探去跟踪他的夫人。(8) 如果它没有看到影子，则预示着春天即将到来。(9) 穿过她的阴影的所有孕妇会失败。(10) 添加阴影的写生使用简单的图层样式。

translation: v.摇动；震动；握手n.片刻；摇晃；奶昔
examples: (1) Give the bottle a couple of shakes before pouring the juice.(2) He shook his head in disapproval.(3) His voice shook with fear.(4) It's time to shake out the red flag.(5) She reached out her hand and offered to shake his.(6) When people meet,they shake hands as a token of friendship.(7) He finished the bottle of wine in a shake.(8) The old man was all of a shake at the news.(9) You should give him a fair shake.
(1) 倒果汁前，先把瓶子摇几下。(2) 他摇了摇头表示反对。(3) 他害怕得声音发抖。(4) 是把这面红旗打开的时候了。(5) 她伸了手去,想和他握手。(6) 人们相时逢的候(7) 他片刻功夫就把一瓶酒喝完了。(8) 听到这个消息，老人浑身直发抖。(9) 你应该对他待之以诚。

translation: adj.浅的；薄的n.浅滩；浅处v.变浅
examples: (1) This shallow ford made it possible for us to cross the river.(2) That dish is too shallow to serve soup in.(3) Homesickness is a shallow strait, I stand here, my homeland is on the other side.(4) She has a rather shallow personality.(5) It is only shallow people who judge by appearances.(6) This shallow ford made it possible for us to cross the river.(7) The group became trapped in a shallow cove of Long Island south last week.(8) The ship was grounded in shallow water.(9) A shallow place in a body of water,such as a river,where one can cross by walking or riding on an animal or in a vehicle.(10) The rock assemblage of shallow exposed bank-microfacies is the basis of the formation of pore layers and reservoir permeability systems.

(1) 我们有可能从这片浅滩过河。(2) 那只盘子太浅了，不能盛汤。(3) 乡愁是一湾浅浅的海峡,我在这头,大陆在那头。(4) 她的个性相当浅薄。(5) 只有浅薄的人才会以貌取人。(6) 我们有可能从这片浅滩过河。(7) 上个礼拜，这些海豚在南边长海岛的浅滩被困住了。(8) 船在水浅处搁浅。(9) 可涉水而过的地方河等水体的浅处，人们可以在此步行或骑动物或用交通工具淌过。(10) 变浅暴露滩微相的岩石组合是孔隙层和储渗体形成的基础。

translation: n.羞愧；耻辱；可耻的人或物vt.使丢脸；使羞愧；使蒙羞
examples: (1) He had no sense of shame and never felt guilty.(2) He saved the child at the risk of his own life and put all those who looked on to shame.(3) Your bad behavior brings shame on the whole school.(4) It is a shame to take money from those who can't afford it.(5) He was shamed by how much more work the others had done.(6) Her careful work put all the rest to shame.(7) Such an act of cowardice by an officer shames his whole regiment.
(1) 他毫无羞耻之心，而且从不觉得内疚。(2) 他冒着生命危险救了那个孩子,使所有旁观者都相形见绌。(3) 你的恶劣行径给整个学校带来耻辱。(4) 拿别人的钱使人家无以自立是十分可耻的。(5) 别人做得多得多，他感到很难为情。(6) 她的细致工作使得其余所有的人都自愧不如。(7) 一个军官作出如此胆怯的行为使整个团都蒙受羞辱。

translation: v.诱拐；诱骗；强行使当水手Shanghai.n.上海（中国城市）
examples: (1) When Tom was a boy, he was shanghaied and sent to North America.(2) "(actors, singers, etc.) perform for outside salary income without approval by the unit they belong to"(3) She shanghaied him into buying her a mink coat.
(1) 汤姆小时候被拐骗并被送到了北美。(2) 走穴(3) 她用诱骗的手段迫使他买给她一件貂皮大衣。

translation: vt.分享，共享；分配；共有vi.分享n.一份；股份；分担；犁头
examples: (1) Children should be taught to share their toys.(2) Keep your fears to yourself but share your courage with others.(3) Share the fruit among your friends.(4) I share a bedroom with my sister.(5) There is only one bedroom, so we'll have to share(6) Your share of the cost is 10 pounds.(7) She's got all her money in stocks and shares.(8) The plough was already scoring in the field opposite the window, and where the share has been, the earth was pressed flat and gleamed with moisture.
(1) 应该教育孩子们分享玩具。(2) 把恐惧留给自己,和他人分享勇气。(3) 把水果分给你的朋友们。(4) 我和我姐姐合住一间卧室。(5) 只有一间卧室,所以我们得合着用。(6) 你这一份费用是10英镑。(7) 她所有的钱都投放到股票里去了。(8) 对着窗户的外面，铧犁正在田野划刻着印迹，犁头所到之处，土被压得平平整整，湿气在阳光下闪亮。

translation: adj.锋利的；突然的；灵敏的；明显的；辛辣的；【音】升音阶的adv.准时地；突然地；偏高地
examples: (1) Cats have sharp claws.(2) There is a sharp drop in the prices.(3) It was very sharp of you to have noticed that.(4) Bring the object into focus if you want a sharp photograph.(5) The cheese is a little too sharp for me.(6) We arrived at three(o'clock) sharp.(7) He is singing sharp.
(1) 猫有锋利的爪子。(2) 价格出现暴跌。(3) 你注意到了这一点是够机灵的。(4) 要照出清晰的照片，就要把焦点对准物体。(5) 我觉得这干酪味道重了点。(6) 我们在三点整到达。(7) 他唱得偏高一点。

translation: vt.使尖锐；磨快；加剧vi.变尖锐
examples: (1) My pencil is blunt, could you lend me a knife to sharpen it?(2) Generations of urban living sharpened their wits.(3) Strikes will sharpen the country's dilemma.(4) The soldiers sharpened up their knives.(5) The debate sharpened considerably.
(1) 我的铅笔钝了，你能借我把刀子削一削吗？(2) 世代居住在城市里使他们磨练了才智。(3) 罢工将加剧这个国家的困境。(4) 战士们把刀磨得锋利。(5) 辩论变得相当激烈。

translation: v.刮；剃；修剪；掠过；削减n.剃须；修面；剃刀
examples: (1) I lathered my face and started to shave.(2) He shaved his head bald.(3) He asked me to shave the lawn.(4) The ball narrowly shaved his off stump.(5) The lorry shaved the barrier, scraping its side.(6) A sharp razor gives a good shave.(7) I can't seem to get a close shave around my chin area.(8) The barber gave him a shave and a haircut.(9) Do not disassemble or handle the shave roughly.
(1) 我往脸上涂了皂沫，然后开始刮胡子。(2) 他剃了个光头。(3) 他叫我修剪草坪。(4) 那个球紧贴着他的三柱门的外柱掠过。(5) 那辆卡车掠过路障，刮坏了车身。(6) 锋利的剃须刀好剃须。(7) 我好像没法把下颚部分剃干净。(8) 理发师给他修面理发。(9) 不要拆卸或粗暴地操作电动剃须刀。

translation: n.电动剃刀；理发师；小伙子；骗子
examples: (1) I want to buy an electric shaver.(2) Please fetch me the electric shaver from the room upstairs.(3) You cheeky young shaver!
(1) 我想买把电动剃须刀。(2) 请帮我把楼上房间里的电动剃须刀拿来。(3) 你这个毛头小伙子！

translation: n.被单；纸；(薄)片；一片n.[船]帆脚索v.铺盖；使成片adj.片状的
examples: (1) We change the sheet every week.(2) The doctor wanted us to use the sheet for a shroud.(3) He put a fresh sheet in the typewriter.(4) She went as white as a sheet when she heard the news.(5) They cut holes on the sheet of metal with a punch press.(6) The rain came down in sheets.(7) Then he found the sheet and the sail filled and he brought the skiff onto her course.(8) A plastic sheet was pegged down over the compost heap to hasten decomposition.(9) In effecting recharge by flooding, water is spread over the land surface in a thin sheet.
(1) 我们每个星期换一次床单。(2) 医生想让我们用床单当裹尸布。(3) 他把一张纸放进了打字机中。(4) 她听到这个消息顿时脸色苍白。(5) 他们用冲床在金属板上打孔。(6) 大雨滂沱。(7) 然后他摸到了帆脚索，张起帆来，使小船顺着原来的航线走。(8) 把塑料布铺盖在肥堆上，并用木桩固定好，以加速肥料腐烂。(9) 以漫灌法所进行的补给是将水成片地铺洒在地面上。

translation: n.避难所；庇护；庇护所v.保护；隐匿；庇护
examples: (1) The refugees' main requirements are food and shelter.(2) In the storm I took shelter under the tree.(3) The spectators scuttled for shelter when it began to rain.(4) People were scrambling madly for shelter.(5) These plants must be sheltered from direct sunlight.(6) This cave served as a hideout for a bearded seal seeking shelter from the harsh Arctic climate.(7) You can't shelter your brother from blame in the accident.
(1) 难民的主要必需品是食物和住所。(2) 暴风雨时，我正在树下躲避。(3) 一下起雨来，观众就纷纷找地方躲避。(4) 人们疯了似的抢着往隐蔽处跑。(5) 这种植物必须遮起来，免受阳光直射。(6) 这个洞窟被髯海豹用来作为躲避严酷的北极气候的隐匿之所。(7) 你不可以庇护你的兄弟，使其免受事故的责难。

translation: n.震惊；震动；冲击；休克v.使震惊；使震动；使受电击
examples: (1) It gave me quite a shock to be told I was seriously ill.(2) His death was a great shock to us all.(3) We must take steps to prevent shock in the patient.(4) The violence and bad language in the program shocked many of the viewers.(5) They used him to shock the others.(6) Anyone touching that wire could get badly shocked.
(1) 听说我的病很严重，我吃了一惊。(2) 他的死使我们大家都大为震惊。(3) 我们必须采取措施防止病人休克。(4) 节目中的暴力场面和难听的粗话使许多观众感到震惊。(5) 他们利用他来吓唬别人。(6) 任何人碰到那根电线都会遭到严重的电击。

translation: n.射击；发射；猎场动词shoot的现在分词.
examples: (1) The militiamen often practise shooting.(2) A man with a gun is shooting at the crowds.(3) I know I saw excess energy shooting from his eyes.(4) The film-maker appealed to farmers and owners of shooting estates to help protect the species.
(1) 民兵们经常练习射击。(2) 有一持枪男子向人群射击。(3) 我知道我看到了多余的能量从他的眼睛中发射出来。(4) 制片人呼吁农夫和猎场拥有者帮助保护这一物种。

translation: 店员
examples: (1) The shop assistant was wearing a white overall.(2) The old lady counted out thirty pence and gave it to the shop assistant.(3) Shop assistant required. Apply within.(4) An observant shop assistant had remembered exactly what the man was wearing.(5) The shop assistant was not in the least afraid of the trouble.
(1) 那店员穿著白色长罩衣。(2) 老太婆一个个地数出三十便士给了售货员。(3) 招聘店员.(4) 有个机警的店员准确记得那个男子的穿著。(5) 那店员一点也不怕麻烦。

translation: n.店主；零售商人
examples: (1) The shopkeeper managed to keep in with his customers.(2) She complained loudly to the shopkeeper, who answered her mildly.(3) I'm sure the shopkeeper gave me short measure when she weighed out the potatoes.
(1) 店主设法做到同顾客搞好关系。(2) 她大声对店主抱怨，店主却温和地回答她。(3) 我肯定那店老板给我称土豆时,扣了分量。

translation: n.岸；滨
examples: (1) The breakers came tumbling onto the shore.(2) They anchored their ship off the shore.
(1) 浪涛滚滚而来拍打著岸边。(2) 他们在滨外抛锚泊船。

translation: n.缺点；短处
examples: (1) Not being punctual is his greatest shortcoming.(2) Donna is sensible of his shortcoming.(3) No matter who point out our shortcoming, we will correct them.(4) If it were not for this shortcoming, he is a fairly good teacher.
(1) 不守时间是他的最大缺点。(2) 唐纳知道他自己的缺点。(3) 不管谁指出我们的缺点，我们都改正。(4) 要不是有这一缺点，他本是一个相当好的教师。

translation: adv.立刻；马上
examples: (1) And it's hardly a coincidence that shortly after Usmanov hires a big shot PR firm these kinds of pieces begin to appear in the papers.(2) I hope to announce the winner shortly.(3) I shall therefore be going to the bank shortly to complete these formalities so that there is no further delay in releasing the documents and consignment.
(1) 当乌斯马诺夫刚刚雇用了强悍的公关公司后，这类东西就立刻出现在报纸上，很难让人信服这只是一种巧合。(2) 我希望马上宣布胜利者的名字。(3) 我因此将打算马上去银行来完成这些手续以便在让渡货物和文件的过程中别再耽误了。

translation: n.短裤
examples: (1) Shorts that ride up can be very uncomfortable.(2) Men and women wear shorts in hot weather.
(1) 短裤向上绷紧会使人感到很不舒服。(2) 在天热时男人和妇女穿短裤。

translation: n.短波
examples: (1) I am able to pick you up on the short wave radio.(2) In radio communication, either short or long waves may be used.
(1) 我能用短波收音机收听到你的信号。(2) 无线电通讯可以采用短波也可以采用长波。

translation: n.肩膀；肩部v.承担；扛；肩负；(用肩)推挤
examples: (1) The bullet wounded his shoulder.(2) Her hand rested lightly upon his shoulder.(3) The bullet went clean through his shoulder.(4) We walked in the street shoulder to shoulder.(5) Her hair falls over her shoulder.(6) The manager was ready to shoulder the blame.(7) You don't need to shoulder the blame for this failure.(8) He can shoulder a 200-pound bag.(9) The soldiers shouldered their kit and moved on.(10) Jack shoulder his way through the crowd.
(1) 子弹打伤了他的肩膀。(2) 她的手轻轻地搭在他的肩膀上。(3) 子弹穿透他的肩膀。(4) 我们肩并肩走在街上。(5) 她的头发垂肩。(6) 经理愿意承担过失。(7) 你无须对这次失败承担责任。(8) 他能扛两百磅的袋子。(9) 士兵们背起行装，继续前进。(10) 杰克用肩从人群中挤过去了。

translation: vi.收缩；退缩；萎缩；畏惧，害怕vt.使收缩n.收缩；萎缩n.精神科医生
examples: (1) Will this woolen sweater shrink when washed?(2) The company's profit margins shrank from 32.5% to 17%.(3) The economy is shrinking instead of growing.(4) The hot water shrank my pullover.(5) You can expect some shrink when the jeans are washed.(6) There has been some shrink in our export trade.(7) My aunt saw this shrink after her divorce.
(1) 这件羊毛衫洗后会缩水吗？(2) 该公司的边际利润率从32.5%降到了17%。(3) 经济正在萎缩而不是在增长中。(4) 我的套头毛衣遇热水后收缩了。(5) 这种牛仔裤洗后要缩些水。(6) 我们的出口贸易已有些萎缩。(7) 我阿姨在离婚后去见过这位心理医生。

translation: n.梭子；穿梭；往返移动之物；航天飞机v.往返运送；穿梭移动
examples: (1) The shuttle flies back and forth on the loom.(2) He refined the whole art of shuttle diplomacy.(3) There is a shuttle service between the city center and the air station.(4) The U.S. made the first space shuttle in the world.(5) We shuttled the passengers to the city center by helicopter.
(1) 织布机上梭子来回飞动。(2) 他把穿梭外交艺术提高到炉火纯青的地步。(3) 在市中心和飞机场之间有往返的穿梭运行班车。(4) 美国制造了世界上第一架航天飞机。(5) 我们来来回回地用直升机把旅客运送到市中心。

translation: n.疾病；呕吐
examples: (1) Chicken pox is a common childhood sickness.(2) The holy man healed them of their sickness.(3) The boy didn't take the exam under the pretence of sickness.(4) Sickness often results from eating too much.(5) The symptoms of this disease are fever and sickness.
(1) 水痘是一种常见的儿童期疾病。(2) 那位神职人员治好了他们的疾病。(3) 那个男孩借口生病没有参加考试。(4) 呕吐常因饮食过量所致。(5) 这种病的症状是发烧与呕吐。

translation: n.支路；旁侧路
examples: (1) The left arch spans a minor road running parallel to the river.
(1) 左桥洞跨越一条与河流平行的支路。

translation: adj.旁的；横向的adv.旁地；横向地=sideways.
examples: (1) A crab moves sideways.(2) He looked sideways at me.
(1) 螃蟹横着爬行。(2) 他斜着眼看我。

translation: adv.向旁边；斜着地；向侧面地adj.旁边的；斜着；向侧面的
examples: (1) The trees are bushing out sideways.(2) He dropped the box sideways, so it hit me.(3) He looked sideways at me in the meeting.(4) They stepped sideways down the stairs.(5) She had to turn sideways to get through the door.(6) Her new job is just a sideways move.(7) This sideways motion often causes an imbalance of the body, too.
(1) 这些树正往四周长杈。(2) 他把箱子向旁边一扔(3) 他在会议上斜着眼看我。(4) 他们侧身一步步走下楼梯。(5) 她只能侧身过门。(6) 她的新工作只是平级调动。(7) 这个横向动作经常引起身体的不平衡。

translation: n.叹气；叹息v.叹息；惋惜
examples: (1) When he heard the news, he uttered a sigh.(2) She heaved a sigh and became lost in thought.(3) The old man uttered a sigh and went out.(4) I bury my face in my hands and heave a sigh.(5) He sighed with despair.(6) ‘I wish I didn't have so much to do,’she sighed.(7) She looked out of the window, sighing for her lost youth.
(1) 听到这消息时，他叹了口气。(2) 她叹了口气，随即陷入了沉思。(3) 那位老人叹息了一声,走了出去。(4) 我掩着面叹息。(5) 他绝望地叹了口气。(6) ｀我但愿没有这么多事情要做,＇她叹著气说。(7) 她看着窗外，为她失去的青春而惋惜。

translation: n.视力；看见；视线；景物v.瞄准；看见；观测
examples: (1) I'm having laser treatment to improve my sight.(2) The captain ordered us to shoot any strangers on sight.(3) The train is still in sight.(4) He saw some amazing sights at the zoo.(5) The ghastly sight gave him the shudders.(6) The hunter sighted carefully before firing his gun.(7) After three days at sea, we sighted land.(8) We like to sight stars with the telescope at night.
(1) 我正在接受激光治疗来提高我的视力。(2) 船长命令我们凡是看见的陌生人都要将其枪毙。(3) 火车仍在视线内。(4) 他在动物园里看到一些珍禽异兽。(5) 那恐怖的景象使他感到恐惧。(6) 猎人射击前仔细瞄准。(7) 我们在海上航行三天後见到了陆地。(8) 我们喜欢在夜晚用望远镜观测星星。

translation: n.【U】观光；游览
examples: (1) I spent most of my time in sightseeing.(2) We spent the remainder of the day sightseeing.(3) They embarked on an orgy of sightseeing.(4) Good morning, Mr.Smith. Sightseeing is our agenda today.
(1) 我大部分时间都用在观光游览上了。(2) 这天剩下的时间我们到各处观光。(3) 他们开始尽情地观光游览。(4) 早上好，史密斯先生。我们今天的日程安排是游览。

translation: n.信号；标志v.(发信号)通知、表示adj.显著的
examples: (1) A red lamp is often a danger signal.(2) I corrected my watch by the time signal.(3) I've called several times, but I keep getting a busy signal.(4) We live too far from the city to get a strong television signal.(5) Her speech yesterday is a signal that her view has changed.(6) The police signalled the traffic to move forward slowly.(7) People speak of Mark Twain as a signal humourous writer.(8) This is a signal success.
(1) 红灯常常是危险的信号。(2) 我按报时信号校正我的表。(3) 我打了好几次了,可是一直是忙音。(4) 我们住的地方离城里太远, 不能收到清晰的电视图像。(5) 她昨天的讲话标志著她的观点已经转变。(6) 警察向来往车辆打信号，示意缓慢前行。(7) 人们称马克·吐温为杰出的幽默作家。(8) 这是显著的成功。

translation: n.签署；书帖；有特征的符号；【计】签名
examples: (1) He traced his signature laboriously.(2) Her signature was an illegible scrawl.
(1) 他吃力地签上自己的名字。(2) 她的签字潦草难辩。

translation: n.重要性；意义
examples: (1) Few people realized the significance of the discovery.(2) Our boss urged on us the significance of punctuality.(3) He puzzled out the significance of the statement.(4) Could you explain to me the significance of this part of the contract?
(1) 很少有人意识到这一发现的重要性.(2) 老板向我们强调守时的重要性。(3) 他解释了这一论断的意义。(4) 你能给我解释一下合同这一部分的含义吗？

translation: n.沉默；寂静vt.使安静；使沉默
examples: (1) We interpreted his silence as a refusal.(2) His forceful arguments reduced his opponents to silence.(3) There was nothing but silence in the room.(4) A terrible silence descended upon the whole hall.(5) The teacher tried to silence the pupils.(6) The speaker tried to silence the angry crowd .(7) The enemy's guns were silenced by repeated bombings.
(1) 我们认为他的沉默是拒绝的表示。(2) 他那有力的论点驳得对手哑口无言。(3) 这间屋内声息全无，一片寂静。(4) 一阵可怕的寂静突然笼罩着整个厅堂。(5) 老师设法让学生们安静下来。(6) 讲话者试图使愤怒的人群安静下来。(7) 敌人的炮火因遭到轮番轰炸而沉寂了。

translation: adj.安静的；不吵闹的；沉默的；无言的
examples: (1) Would you be good enough to keep silent?(2) The old house was quite silent.(3) We sailed into a beautiful and silent bay.(4) She was a silent girl, cool and remote.(5) I represent the silent majority.(6) If you are arrested you have the right to remain silent.(7) She was blind to the silent worship in his eyes.
(1) 请你保持安静好吗？(2) 这所旧房子非常寂静。(3) 我们驶进一个美丽而安静的海湾。(4) 她是一个沉默寡言的女孩，对人冷漠而孤傲。(5) 我代表沉默的大多数。(6) 如果你被捕，你有权保持沉默。(7) 她没有发觉他眼里流露出的无声的敬慕之情。

translation: adj.愚蠢的；琐屑的；可笑的；犯晕的n.（通常指小孩子）淘气鬼；傻孩子
examples: (1) The silly ending robs the plot of any credibility.(2) Don't get upset over silly things that people say.(3) I look pretty silly in this dress.(4) I took a swing at him and knocked him silly.(5) Listen, silly, we have to leave now.(6) He is not a silly boy,not by a jugful.(7) No, silly, those aren't your shoes!
(1) 这愚蠢的结尾使得整个情节变得一点都不可信。(2) 不要在意人们的闲言碎语。(3) 我穿这条裙看上去很可笑。(4) 我挥拳打了他一下, 把他打得晕头转向。(5) 听着,小淘气鬼,我们现在得走了。(6) 他不是一个傻孩子。(7) 不对，傻孩子，那不是你的鞋！

translation: n.银币；银器；银；银灰色adj.银的；银色的vt.镀银于；使 ... 成银色
examples: (1) He had some silver in his pocket.(2) Acid had pitted the surface of the silver.(3) His black hair was threaded with silver.(4) This board was cast in bronze not in silver.(5) This becomes silver gray, while I remember your handset was black.(6) You can recognize the genuine tape because of its silver grey color.(7) He found the chest to contain silver coins.(8) She wore a silver chain around her neck.(9) Every cloud has a silver lining.(10) There is not a silver hair on her head.(11) He silvered a mirror.(12) The years have silvered her hair.

(1) 他口袋里有些银币。(2) 酸把银器的表面腐蚀了。(3) 他的黑发中夹杂着银发。(4) 这个牌匾是铜铸的,不是银制的。(5) 怎么变银灰色了，我记得你的手机是黑色的。(6) 你可以认出这种真正的带子，它是银灰色的。(7) 他发现那囗箱子装着银币。(8) 她脖子上戴着一条银项链。(9) 黑暗中总有一丝光明。(10) 她头上没有一根银发。(11) 他给镜子镀上了一层银。(12) 岁月已使她的青丝似雪。

translation: adj.类似的
examples: (1) The two buildings are similar on the whole.(2) I sympathize with you; I've had a similar unhappy experience myself.(3) He talked about it in a similar way.(4) Gold is similar in color to brass.(5) We have similar opinions.
(1) 从整体来看，这两幢楼是相似的。(2) 我很同情你，我自己也有过类似的不幸遭遇。(3) 他对此事有相似的说法。(4) 金和铜颜色相仿。(5) 我们的看法相同。

translation: adj.简单的；朴素的；单纯的；笨的
examples: (1) In each cave they constructed five simple beds.(2) As he had forgot his keys, he got into the house by the simple expedient of climbing through the window.(3) I like my clothes to be simple but elegant.(4) "A-bomb, H-bomb and nuclear-powered submarine"(5) I'm not so simple as to think it will be easy.(6) She doesn't understand you. She's a bit simple.
(1) 他们在每间窑洞里做了5个简单的床。(2) 他由于忘了带钥匙，便以简单的应急办法从窗户爬进屋里。(3) 我喜欢朴素但漂亮雅致的衣服。(4) 两弹一艇(5) 我决不致于笨得以为那是容易的事。(6) 她不明白你的意思。她有点笨。

translation: adj.愚蠢的；头脑简单的
examples: (1) While intelligent people can often simplify the complex, a fool is more likely to complicate the simple.(2) Simple Simon met a pie man going to the fair.(3) Eleanor's younger brother Freder was a simple youth.
(1) 聪明人常常能把复杂的事变得简单，而愚蠢的人却常常把简单的事复杂化。(2) 头脑简单的西蒙遇到了一个卖馅饼的人正往集市去。(3) 埃莉诺的弟弟弗雷德尔是一个头脑简单的年轻人。

translation: vt.简化；使简单
examples: (1) That will simplify my task.(2) She simplified the instructions so that the children could understand them.(3) Can you simplify your language a little?
(1) 那可简化了我的工作。(2) 她简化了指令以便于儿童理解。(3) 你能不能把你的语言改得简单一点?

translation: adv.简单地；仅仅；简直
examples: (1) Most of these problems won't simply dissolve.(2) Put simply, we accept their offer or go bankrupt.(3) You may open the tin simply by pulling the puller.(4) Is success simply a matter of working hard?(5) I bought the house simply because it was large.(6) The holidays simply sped by.(7) That meal was simply divine!
(1) 大多数这些问题不会简单地解决。(2) 简单地说吧，我们要么接受他们的条件，要么破产。(3) 你只要拉这个拉出器，就可以很容易地把罐头打开。(4) 是否只要勤奋就能成功？(5) 我购买了这房子，只是因为它面积大。(6) 假期简直是一晃而过。(7) 那顿饭简直好极了。

translation: adv.真诚地；真心地
examples: (1) She praised him sincerely for his victory.(2) I sincerely hope you'll come with us.(3) Do you sincerely want to succeed?
(1) 她真诚地表扬了他的胜利。(2) 我真诚希望你和我们一起去。(3) 你真的想要成功吗?

translation: 夫或妻的姊妹
examples: (1) The day he was born he looked so much like my sister in law, But now I can see my side of family in him ye!!!!(2) My sister in law has two husbands, my mother in law also has two husbands," Indira says.(3) And she said， Behold， thy sister in law is gone back unto her people， and unto her gods： return thou after thy sister in law.(4) The sister in law went to work straight, and the income is steady, two persons can also spend this period of time together.(5) And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.(6) And she said, Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people, and unto her gods: return thou after thy sister in law.

(1) 刚出生那几天很像妈妈,但是最近去看他,他竟然慢慢有我们周家的家族特徵了耶!!!(2) 我弟妹有两个老公，我婆婆也有两个老公。”(3) 路得说，不要催我回去不跟随你，你往哪里去，我也往那里去。你在哪里住宿，我也在那里住宿。你的国就是我的国，你的神就是我的神。(4) 弟妹倒是一直上班的,而且收入稳定,二人还能共同度过这段日子。(5) 拿俄米说,看哪,你嫂子已经回她本国,和她所拜的神那里去了,你也跟着你嫂子回去吧。(6) 16路得说，不要催我回去不跟随你，你往哪里去，我也往那里去。你在哪里住宿，我也在那里住宿。你的国就是我的国，你的神就是我的神。

translation: n.形势；局面；位置；职位；处境；状况
examples: (1) The overall situation is worsening.(2) The economic situation is now different.(3) You dealt with an awkward situation very tactfully.(4) The house is in a good situation at the top of the hill.(5) He was promoted to a high situation for his outstanding performance in the project.(6) He was in a dangerous situation.(7) He laughed off an embarrassing situation.(8) He gave a neat summary of the financial situation.
(1) 整体形势在日益恶化。(2) 现在经济形势不同了。(3) 你很巧妙地处理了一个困难的局面。(4) 这座房子在山上的一个好位置上。(5) 因为在项目中的突出表现,他被提升到高职位。(6) 他处境危险。(7) 他以笑来解除这种尴尬的处境。(8) 他对财务状况做了简要的概括。

translation: n.六分之一；六度音num.第六
examples: (1) I would like a sixth of the cake.(2) My new house is on the sixth floor.(3) He was counted out at the end of the sixth round.
(1) 我要六分之一个蛋糕。(2) 我的新房子在六楼。(3) 他在第六轮被宣布为失败。

translation: n.六十adj.六十的；六十个的
examples: (1) The country maintains some sixty missions abroad.(2) Now my husband is sixty, I know.
(1) 该国在海外设有约六十个使馆。(2) 现在我的丈夫六十岁，我知道。

translation: num.十六
examples: (1) There are sixteen ounces in one pound.(2) He was scarcely sixteen when he joined the army.
(1) 一磅有十六盎司。(2) 他参军时刚刚十六岁。

translation: n.十六分之一；第十六(个)；月的第十六日adj.第十六的；十六分之一的
examples: (1) His name is the sixteenth on the list.(2) October sixteenth is World Food Day.(3) My new house is on the sixteenth floor.(4) Tom is one of the seers in the sixteenth century.(5) He was the sixteenth president of the United States.(6) You don't pay attention to rests, especially the eighth rest and sixteenth rest.
(1) 他的名字在名单上排第十六名。(2) 十月十六日为国际粮食日。(3) 我的新家在第十六层。(4) 汤姆是十六世纪的先知。(5) 他是美国的第16届总统。(6) 你对休止符重视不够，尤其是八分休止符和十六分休止符。

translation: n.溜冰板(一种装有滑轮的椭圆形滑板)v.滑滑板

Smoking is now banned in many places of work.现在许多工作场所禁止吸烟。...a no-smoking area.禁烟区2[ADJ 形容词]允许吸烟的 A smoking area is intended for people who want to smoke.   [ADJ n]...the decision to scrap smoking compartments on Kent trains.取消肯特列车上的吸烟车厢的决定3See also:smoke；passive smoking；

translation: adj.光滑的；平稳的；流畅的；圆滑的；可口的；安祥的；均匀的v.使光滑；消除；安慰；理顺(羽毛)
examples: (1) Her skin is as smooth as silk.(2) The birch has smooth bark and slender branches.(3) At 9:50 the plane began a smooth descent through the cloud-smudged sky to Shanghai.(4) The process of negotiation was not entirely smooth.(5) Mix the butter and sugar to a smooth paste.(6) She smoothed out wrinkles out of the tablecloth.(7) No matter how hard she tried, she was unable to smooth over their differences.(8) It has been proposed as a storage option to support large-scale use of photovoltaics as a means to smooth out fluctuations in power generation.
(1) 她的皮肤像丝绸一样光滑。(2) 桦树有光滑的皮和细长的枝。(3) 9点50分,飞机在上海上空开始穿过浓云平稳下降。(4) 谈判的过程并不十分顺畅。(5) 把黄油、糖调匀成糊状。(6) 她把桌布上的皱褶弄平。(7) 不管她怎么努力,也未能消除他们之间的分岐。(8) 有人提议作为存储选项，以支持大规模利用太阳能作为一种手段来理顺波动发电。

Something smooth is free of roughness, stubble, or other imperfections that you can feel with your hands. If your wooden table is giving you splinters, use a sander to smooth it down and make it smooth. As you can see, smooth works as both a verb and an adjective.

Smooth has lots of interesting uses: Caught in a wind storm? Better smooth out your hair when you head inside. Got a friend who's good with the ladies? Try imitating his smooth moves. Need help to smooth out a dispute between two friends? Invite them out for coffee and offer to help them smooth out their differences. Some pianists prefer ivory keys to plastic because they're less smooth, and their fingers don't slip. The best dancers can move smoothly from one move to another.

1[ADJ-GRADED 能被表示程度的副词或介词词组修饰的形容词]光滑的；平滑的 A smooth surface has no roughness, lumps, or holes. ...a rich cream that keeps skin soft and smooth.能让皮肤永葆柔嫩光滑的营养霜...a smooth surface such as glass...如玻璃般光滑的表面The flagstones beneath their feet were worn smooth by centuries of use.他们脚下的石板路经过数百年的踩踏，磨得光溜溜的。smoothness...the smoothness of her skin.她光滑的皮肤2[ADJ-GRADED 能被表示程度的副词或介词词组修饰的形容词]稠度均匀的；细腻匀和的；不结块的 A smooth liquid or mixture has been mixed well so that it has no lumps. Continue whisking until the mixture looks smooth and creamy...一直搅拌，直至混合物变得均匀细腻。Blend the cornflour to a smooth paste with a little cold water.加入少量的凉水，将玉米粉搅拌成均匀的糊状。3[ADJ-GRADED 能被表示程度的副词或介词词组修饰的形容词](葡萄酒、威士忌或咖啡等)醇和的，不烈的，不苦的 If you describe a drink such as wine, whisky, or coffee as smooth, you mean that it is not bitter and is pleasant to drink. This makes the whiskeys much smoother.这样一来，威士忌就醇和多了。4[ADJ-GRADED 能被表示程度的副词或介词词组修饰的形容词](动作等)平稳的，流畅的 A smooth line or movement has no sudden breaks or changes in direction or speed. This exercise is done in one smooth motion.这个练习一气呵成。...the smooth curve of the trunk.树干流畅的曲线smoothlyMake sure that you execute all movements smoothly and without jerking...一定要保证所有动作自然流畅，不要一顿一顿的。'I've no idea,' he said smoothly.他平静地说：“我不知道。”smoothnessSayer was delighted with the smoothness of the engine.塞耶对发动机平稳流畅的运转很是满意。5[ADJ-GRADED 能被表示程度的副词或介词词组修饰的形容词](骑马、航行等)平稳的，顺顺当当的 A smooth ride, flight, or sea crossing is very comfortable because there are no unpleasant movements. The active suspension system gives the car a very smooth ride.这个主动悬架系统使汽车行驶起来非常平稳。smoothnessThe smoothness of the flight was memorable.这次平稳顺利的飞行令人难忘。6[ADJ-GRADED 能被表示程度的副词或介词词组修饰的形容词]顺利的 You use smooth to describe something that is going well and is free of problems or trouble. Political hopes for a swift and smooth transition to democracy have been dashed...迅速而顺利地过渡到民主体制的政治希望破灭了。A number of problems marred the smooth running of this event.一些问题搅乱了这一事件的顺利进展。smoothlySo far, talks at GM have gone smoothly...迄今为止，在通用汽车公司进行的会谈进展顺利。The operation was moving along smoothly.手术进展顺利。smoothness...airlines believed regulations requiring identification of all unaccompanied hold baggage would damage the smoothness of their operations.航空公司认为，要求确认所有非随行行李的规定会阻碍公司营运的顺利进行。7[ADJ-GRADED 能被表示程度的副词或介词词组修饰的形容词]故作殷勤有礼的；精明圆滑的；圆通的 If you describe a man as smooth, you mean that he is extremely smart, confident, and polite, often in a way that you find rather unpleasant. Twelve extremely good-looking, smooth young men have been picked as finalists...12 名特别漂亮精明的青年男子被选为参加决赛的选手。He was the smoothest and probably the most powerful chief of staff in political memory.在人们关于政治人物的记忆里，他是最精明、可能也是最有权势的参谋长。8[VERB 动词]抚平；抹平 If you smooth something, you move your hands over its surface to make it smooth and flat.   [V n with adv]  [V n]She stood up and smoothed down her frock...她站起身，抹平了裙子。Bardo smoothed his moustache.巴多抚了抚胡子。9[VERB 动词]抹；捋 If you smooth something somewhere, you use your hands to spread it there.   [V n prep]  [V n with adv]She smoothed the lotion across his shoulder blades...她在他的肩胛骨上抹了乳液。His fingers smoothed the hair back from her face.他用手把她脸上的头发捋到脑后。10[PHRASE 短语]铺平道路；促进 If you smooth the path or smooth the way towards something, you make it easier or more likely to happen. <div class="word_gram" id="word_gra

translation: n.小吃；点心vi.吃点心
examples: (1) Usually I only have a snack at lunchtime.(2) Apples are a more nutritional snack than popcorn.(3) If you snack too much, you may get fat.(4) She likes to snack while watching TV.
(1) 我中午通常只吃点心。(2) 苹果是比爆米花更有营养的零食。(3) 零食吃的太多,你会长胖的。(4) 她喜欢一边看电视一边吃零嘴。

1[N-COUNT 可数名词]快餐；便餐 A snack is a simple meal that is quick to cook and to eat. Lunch was a snack in the fields.午饭是在野外吃的便餐。2[N-COUNT 可数名词]小吃；零嘴 A snack is something such as a chocolate bar that you eat between meals. Do you eat sweets, cakes or sugary snacks?你吃糖果、蛋糕或甜点吗？3[VERB 动词]吃小吃；吃点心 If you snack, you eat snacks between meals.   [V on n]  [V]Instead of snacking on crisps and chocolate, nibble on celery or carrot...不要把薯片和巧克力当零食来吃，要吃些芹菜和胡萝卜。She would improve her diet if she ate less fried food and snacked less.如果她少吃油炸食品和零食的话，她的饮食结构就会有所改观。

translation: 快餐柜； 小吃店
examples: (1) Don't stay too long at the snack bar.(2) I am going to the snack bar.(3) No, I'm going to the snack bar to get a doughnut and some milk.(4) A snack bar or small cafeteria, as on a military installation.
(1) 别在快餐馆耽误太长时间。(2) 我正要上小吃店。(3) 不，我要到小吃店买一个油炸圈饼和一些牛奶。(4) 随军小卖部小吃店或小自助餐厅，如军事单位中的
1[N-COUNT 可数名词]快餐店；小吃店 A snack bar is a place where you can buy drinks and simple meals such as sandwiches.

translation: n.抢夺；一阵；一点点v.夺取；抓住
examples: (1) The thief made a snatch at the woman's purse.(2) He made a brave snatch at victory but failed.(3) He has a snatch of sleep sitting in his chair.(4) They put the snatch on him for a cut of the take.(5) He snatched up his gun and fired.(6) The hawk snatched the chicken and flew away.(7) He would snatch eagerly at a plan.(8) I must learn to snatch at every chance to meet him.
(1) 小偷试图抢夺那妇女的钱包。(2) 他奋力争取胜利，但是失败了。(3) 他坐在椅子里稍睡片刻。(4) 他们强要他分给他们一分。(5) 他突然拿起枪来射击。(6) 老鹰抓住小鸡飞走了。(7) 他会热切地抓住这个计策。(8) 我必须学会抓住一切机会同他见面。
When you snatch something, you grab it — either literally or figuratively. You might eagerly snatch the TV remote or your best friend's idea. Snatching can be nasty.

You might snatch a lost balloon before it gets away, or snatch your cat before he can escape the room. The verb snatch can also be used in a figurative way, like when you snatch the first job offer that comes your way after graduating from college. The origin is most likely the Middle English word snacche, which means "to suddenly snap at," or in its noun form, "a trap."

1[VERB 动词]一把抓住；迅速地夺取 If you snatch something or snatch at something, you take it or pull it away quickly.   [V n prep]  [V n with adv]  [V at n]Mick snatched the cards from Archie's hand...米克一把夺过阿奇手里的牌。He snatched up the telephone...他迅速地抓起了话筒。The thin wind snatched at her skirt.一阵小风呼地吹起了她的裙子。2[VERB 动词]强抢；夺走 If something is snatched from you, it is stolen, usually using force. If a person is snatched, they are taken away by force.   [be V-ed]  [usu passive]If your bag is snatched, let it go...要是有人抢你的包，就让他拿去。Mr Hillman was snatched by kidnappers last Thursday.上周四希尔曼先生被绑匪劫走了。snatcherWealthy tourists are tempting targets for bag snatchers.富有的游客很容易成为抢包贼的目标。3[VERB 动词]抓住(机会)；抓紧时间(吃东西、休息等)；抽空做 If you snatch an opportunity, you take it quickly. If you snatch something to eat or a rest, you have it quickly in between doing other things.   [V n]I snatched a glance at the mirror...我乘机瞥了一眼镜子。You can even snatch a few hours off...你甚至可以抓紧时间休息几个小时。He was going out for a run, then snatching a piece of toast and a cup of coffee.他准备出去跑步，然后抽空吃上一片面包，喝上一杯咖啡。4[VERB 动词]侥幸获得(胜利)；险胜 If you snatch victory in a competition, you defeat your opponent by a small amount or just before the end of the contest.   [V n]The American came from behind to snatch victory by a mere eight seconds...美国人后来居上，仅以 8 秒钟的优势赢得了胜利。Chesterfield snatched a third goal.切斯特菲尔德攻入第三粒进球。5[N-COUNT 可数名词](谈话或歌曲的)片段 A snatch of a conversation or a song is a very small piece of it.   [usu N of n]I heard snatches of the conversation.我听见了一点谈话内容。6[PHRASE 短语]反败为胜/反胜为败 If someone snatches victory from the jaws of defeat, they win when it seems that they are certain to lose. If someone snatches defeat from the jaws of victory, they lose when it seems that they are certain to win.   [V inflects]  [JOURNALISM 新闻]

translation: n.运动鞋n.鬼鬼祟祟的人；卑鄙者
examples: (1) This pair of sneakers looks very nice.
(1) 这双运动鞋看起来很好看。
1[N-COUNT 可数名词]运动鞋 Sneakers are casual shoes with rubber soles.   [usu pl]  [mainly AM 主美]in BRIT, use 英国英语用 trainers

translation: n.喷嚏vi.打喷嚏
examples: (1) A baby's sneeze is not very loud.(2) She let out a loud sneeze.(3) The dust made him sneeze.(4) The pepper in the food caused me to sneeze.(5) I caught a cold and sneezed a lot.
(1) 婴儿的喷嚏不太响。(2) 她打了一个很响的喷嚏。(3) 灰尘使他打了个喷嚏。(4) 这食物中的胡椒味儿呛得我直打喷嚏。(5) 我得了感冒，老是打喷嚏。

1[VERB 动词]打喷嚏 When you sneeze, you suddenly take in your breath and then blow it down your nose noisily without being able to stop yourself, for example because you have a cold.   [V]  [V-ing]What exactly happens when we sneeze?...我们打喷嚏究竟是怎么回事？See your doctor now to beat summer sneezing.马上去看病，把花粉过敏引起的打喷嚏治好。Sneeze is also a noun.Coughs and sneezes spread infections.咳嗽和打喷嚏会传播传染病。2[PHRASE 短语]不容忽视；值得拥有 If you say that something is not to be sneezed at, you mean that it is worth having.   [INFORMAL 非正式]The money's not to be sneezed at.别把这笔钱不当回事。

translation: vi.嗅；嗤之以鼻；找出vt.嗅到；吸入；嗤之以鼻地说n.嗅；吸气；气味
examples: (1) The dog was sniffing at the lamppost.(2) His generous offer is not to be sniffed at.(3) We shouldn't sniff at this opportunity--we any not get another like it.(4) I bet my broker could sniff out some good ones for you.(5) Doves and wolves love to sniff puff enough to cough and sneeze.(6) Otherwise, a malicious eavesdropper on any router between your server and the end user can very easily sniff the sensitive information out of the network packets.(7) Jane sniffed the cool morning air.(8) The countess sniffed her disapproval.(9) This is of advertisers, will sniff out any value?(10) He cleared his nose with a loud sniff.(11) My mother gave a sniff of disapproval.(12) Do you want a sniff of powder?

(1) 那条狗在街灯柱旁嗅来嗅去。(2) 对他的慷慨厚意不可嗤之以鼻。(3) 我们不可小看这个机会--也许我们再也找不到这样的机会了。(4) 我相信我的股票经纪人会帮你找出一些好股票。(5) 鸽子和野狼喜欢嗅粉扑，嗅到咳嗽，打喷嚏。(6) 否则，恶意的监听者就可以在你的应用程序与最终用户之间的任何路由器上通过数据包探嗅到那些敏感的信息。(7) 简深深地吸入清凉的清晨空气。(8) 女伯爵轻蔑地表示不赞同。(9) 这对广告主而言，会嗅出什么价值呢？(10) 他大声吸气清了清鼻子。(11) 我母亲哼了一声，表示不同意。(12) 您想闻闻火药味吗？
Smell that cake baking? No? Take a sniff. A sniff is when you take air in through your nose to smell something.

Dogs sniff a lot. It's how they get to know the world. Imagine this when you see the figurative use for sniff meaning to snoop as in, "The detective was sniffing around for clues." Sniff is one of those words that sound like what they mean. Take a big sniff and listen, you'll see. If you have a cold, and you keep sniffing, you have what's known as the sniffles.

1[VERB 动词](忍住不哭或表示不赞成时)抽鼻子 When you sniff, you breathe in air through your nose hard enough to make a sound, for example when you are trying not to cry, or in order to show disapproval.   [V]  [V n with adv]She wiped her face and sniffed loudly...她抹了一把脸，很响地抽着鼻子。Moira looked around and sniffed. 'This place badly needs a decorator.'...莫伊拉环顾四周，抽了抽鼻子。“这个地方太需要有人来装修一下了。”Then he sniffed. There was a smell of burning...然后他抽了抽鼻子，发觉有一股烧焦的味道。He sniffed back the tears.他抽着鼻子，把眼泪忍了下去。Sniff is also a noun.At last the sobs ceased, to be replaced by sniffs.最后，啜泣终于止住了，只剩下抽鼻子的声音。2[VERB 动词]闻；嗅 If you sniff something or sniff at it, you smell it by sniffing.   [V n]  [V at n]Suddenly, he stopped and sniffed the air...他突然停下来，闻了闻空气里的味道。She sniffed at it suspiciously.她怀疑地闻了闻。3[VERB 动词]嗤之以鼻地表示；轻蔑地说 You can use sniff to indicate that someone says something in a way that shows their disapproval or contempt.   [V with quote]'Tourists!' she sniffed.她轻蔑地说道：“游客!”4[VERB 动词]轻视；蔑视 If you say that something is not to be sniffed at, you think it is very good or worth having. If someone sniffs at something, they do not think it is good enough, or they express their contempt for it.   [be V-ed at]  [V at n]  [usu passive]The salary was not to be sniffed at either...这份工资也不容小觑。Foreign Office sources sniffed at reports that British troops might be sent.外交部消息人士对有可能派出英国军队的报道不屑一顾。5[VERB 动词]用鼻子吸入(胶毒等) If someone sniffs a substance such as glue, they deliberately breathe in the substance or the gases from it as a drug.   [V n]He felt light-headed, as if he'd sniffed glue.他觉得晕乎乎的，好像吸了胶毒一样。sniffer...teenage glue sniffers.吸胶毒的青少年6[N-SING 单数名词]嗅到；感觉到 If you get a sniff of something, you learn or guess that it might be happening or might be near.   [usu N of n]  [INFORMAL 非正式]You know what they'll be like if they get a sniff of a murder investigation...你知道如果他们嗅到马上会进行谋杀调查会怎么样。Have the Press got a sniff yet?...新闻界嗅到了一点消息没有？Then, at the first sniff of danger, he was back at his post.然后，他一嗅到危险的气息，便马上回到自己的岗位。7[N-SING 单数名词]一丝；一点儿 If you say that someone has not had a sniff of something, you mean that they have not had even a small chance of getting it.   [usu a N of]  [INFORMAL 非正式]Winterton has never had a sniff of a government job in his entire twenty-one years in parliament.在国会的整整21年里，温特顿没有得到过任何在政府里工作的机会。相关词组：sniff around sniff out sniff round

translation: n.雪球；打雪仗；滚雪球式的募捐法v.向 ... 丢雪球；使生长或快速的增长
examples: (1) He was hit by a volley of snowballs.(2) We like having snowball fights in winter.(3) The children snowballed each other.(4) Orders for the new product have begun to snowball because of our new ad campaign.
(1) 他被一阵投来的雪球击中了。(2) 我们喜欢在冬天里打雪仗。(3) 孩子们互相掷雪球。(4) 由于我们的新的广告促销活动，新产品的订货单开始像滚雪球一样迅速增多。

1[N-COUNT 可数名词]雪球 A snowball is a ball of snow. Children often throw snowballs at each other. 2[VERB 动词](项目、运动等)迅速增长，滚雪球般增长 If something such as a project or campaign snowballs, it rapidly increases and grows.   [V]From those early days the business has snowballed...这个企业从早期开始就一直在迅速地发展扩大。The investigation snowballed from there and has since led to several arrests.从那里开始，调查范围迅速扩大，有几人已经被逮捕。

translation: n.肥皂；肥皂剧vt.用肥皂洗；阿谀奉承
examples: (1) The soap slipped out of my hand.(2) Tallow can be used for making soap.(3) I only caught the end of the soap opera.(4) This club was beginning to seem like a soap opera.(5) Is it good to soap the baby down each time?(6) Don't touch anything before you soap your hands.(7) It's no good trying to soft soap my father; he's miserable old devil.
(1) 肥皂从我手上滑落了。(2) 动物脂可以用来做香皂。(3) 我只看到了肥皂剧的结尾。(4) 这个社团开始就像一出肥皂剧。(5) 每次都把婴孩身上打上肥皂好吗？(6) 没用香皂洗手之前，什么都不能碰。(7) 试图恭维我父亲是没有用的，他是一个使人伤心的老家伙。

1[N-MASS 物质名词]肥皂 Soap is a substance that you use with water for washing yourself or sometimes for washing clothes. ...a bar of lavender soap.一块薰衣草香皂...a large packet of soap powder.一大盒肥皂粉...a soap bubble.肥皂泡2[VERB 动词]用肥皂擦洗；往…上面抹肥皂 If you soap yourself, you rub soap on your body in order to wash yourself.   [V pron-refl]She soaped herself all over.她把全身涂满肥皂。3[N-COUNT 可数名词]同 soap opera A soap is the same as a soap opera .   [INFORMAL 非正式]

translation: v.抽泣；呜咽n.呜咽；哭泣
examples: (1) Some children often sob themselves to sleep.(2) The hard sob of anger barred her voice.(3) It was a long, grieving sound, like a sigh--almost like a sob.(4) She sobbed into her handkerchief.(5) We could hear the child sobbing in the other room.(6) She sobbed out the story of her son's violent death.(7) The child's sobs gradually died down.
(1) 有些孩子常哭泣着睡着了。(2) 愤怒所产生的痛苦呜咽阻滞着她的语音。(3) 这一声叫喊又悠长又凄楚，似是长叹，又似是呜咽。(4) 她用手绢掩面啜泣。(5) 我们听到那间屋子里的小孩在抽抽搭搭地哭着。(6) 她哭着诉说儿子横死的经过。(7) 那孩子的啜泣声渐渐静了下来。
If you're so upset you're crying loudly, taking in big gasps of air and heaving your chest, you are sobbing.

Picture a child on the playground who has fallen and can't find his or her mother. The child's face is red and streaked with tears, and he or she is gasping from crying so hard. This poor little boy or girl is sobbing uncontrollably. Sometimes, while trying not to cry, you might let out a single sob. A "sob story" is a story meant to make you feel bad for someone, so bad you might sob for them.

1[VERB 动词]抽噎；呜咽；啜泣 When someone sobs, they cry in a noisy way, breathing in short breaths.   [V]She began to sob again, burying her face in the pillow...她把脸埋在枕头里，又开始抽噎起来。Her sister broke down, sobbing into her handkerchief.她姐姐再也控制不住自己的情绪，捂着手绢呜咽起来。sobbingThe room was silent except for her sobbing.房间里静悄悄的，只有她的啜泣声。2[VERB 动词]呜咽着说；哭诉 If you sob something, you say it while you are crying.   [V with quote]'Everything's my fault,' she sobbed.她呜咽着说：“一切都是我的错。”3[N-COUNT 可数名词]呜咽声 A sob is one of the noises that you make when you are crying.

translation: adj.社会的；社会阶层的；群居的；社交的；好交际的；合群的n.社交聚会；社会保障
examples: (1) Her research is centred on the social effects of unemployment.(2) Many social services are still provided by voluntary societies in our city.(3) Social divisions in the city are stark.(4) Mrs Brown is known as a social climber.(5) Most bees and wasps are social insects.(6) We are invited to a small social gathering.(7) He's not a very social person.(8) They are living on the social now.
(1) 她的研究课题是失业对社会的影响。(2) 在我们的城市，许多社会服务仍然是有志愿团体提供的。(3) 城市里各社会阶层有明确的分野。(4) 布朗太太是有名的趋炎附势的人。(5) 大多数蜜蜂和黄蜂都是群居昆虫。(6) 我们被邀请参加一个小型社交聚会。(7) 他不很合群。(8) 他们现在靠社会保障金维持生活。
If you are social, you like to be around people. A social butterfly is someone who is social or friendly with everyone, flitting from person to person, the way a butterfly might.

The word social comes from the Latin socius meaning "friend." When you're being social, you're everyone's friend. Go to a social, or mixer, and you might make a lot of new friends. Stand in the corner pouting, however, and you're being anti-social. Humans are described as social beings — ones that tend to move or live in groups together, like penguins!

1[ADJ 形容词]社会的 Social means relating to society or to the way society is organized.   [ADJ n]...the worst effects of unemployment, low pay and other social problems.失业、低工资以及其他社会问题造成的最糟糕的影响...long-term social change.长期的社会变革...the acceptance that social conditions influenced crime.对社会状况影响犯罪一说的认可...changing social attitudes.变化中的社会观念...the tightly woven social fabric of small towns.小城镇紧密的社会结构...research into housing and social policy.对住房和社会政策的研究sociallyLet's face it — drinking is a socially acceptable habit.我们面对现实吧——饮酒是一种为社会所接受的习俗。...one of the most socially deprived areas in Britain.英国最封闭的地区之一2[ADJ 形容词]同社会地位(或阶层)有关的 Social means relating to the status or rank that someone has in society.   [ADJ n]Higher education is unequally distributed across social classes...社会各个阶层享受高等教育的权利是不平等的。The guests came from all social backgrounds...客人们来自各个社会阶层。Morisot and Degas moved in the same social circles.莫里索特与德加斯出入相同的社交圈。...a prosperous upper-middle-class couple with social aspirations.雄心勃勃地打算出人头地的一对阔绰的上流社会夫妇sociallyFor socially ambitious couples this is a problem.对于一心要出人头地的夫妇来说，这就是一个问题。...socially disadvantaged children...社会处境不利的儿童I felt there was a lot of translation: n.社会主义
examples: (1) From then on we proceeded to build socialism.(2) Who is the founder of the scientific socialism?
(1) 从那时起,我们开始建设社会主义。(2) 谁是科学社会主义的奠基人？

These days, the word socialism gets tossed around so much, it's almost lost all meaning. Originally, though, it was the bedrock of Marxism and meant that workers and their community should control the market for what they make.

Because the Soviet state eventually strayed far from Marx's idea of socialism towards Lenin's totalitarian communism, socialism is now often used to mean everything from "fascism" to "progressivism." But in its purest form, socialism was a political, social, and economic system meant to empower the working class. In the U.S. today, though, it's often used as shorthand for "the services that government provides and which are paid for by taxes." Depending on who's talking, that idea is either a goal or a target.

1[N-UNCOUNT 不可数名词]社会主义 Socialism is a set of political principles whose general aim is to create a system in which everyone has an equal opportunity to benefit from a country's wealth. Under socialism, the country's main industries are usually owned by the state.

translation: adj.社会主义的n.社会主义者
examples: (1) The state protects socialist public property.(2) They all support socialist policies.(3) He is a socialist.
(1) 国家保护社会主义的公共财产。(2) 他们都拥护社会主义的政策。(3) 他是一位社会主义者。

A socialist is someone who supports the political philosophy of socialism, which is a governmental system that advocates community ownership and control of all lands and businesses rather than individual ownership.

The Latin word socius meant "companion," and led to the Old French word social, from which the word socialist derived. However, the meaning came to be so much more than just "associate." As opposed to a capitalist, a socialist advocates a society based on cooperation rather than competition . Winston Churchill once said, “It is a socialist idea that making profits is a vice; I consider the real vice is making losses."

1[ADJ 形容词]社会主义的 Socialist means based on socialism or relating to socialism.   [usu ADJ n]...members of the ruling Socialist party...执政的社会主义党党员...low-inflation policies practised by the socialist government...社会主义政府执行的低通货膨胀政策Ethiopia was declared a socialist state.埃塞俄比亚被宣布为社会主义国家。2[N-COUNT 可数名词]社会主义者；社会主义党人 A socialist is a person who believes in socialism or who is a member of a socialist party. The French electorate voted out the socialists.法国大选中社会主义党人落选。
